original: de nas skye bo'i tshogs des mtshon cha rnams kyis bcad nas nya ro hi ta de'i sha las blangs nas sman pas bsgo ba'i rim pas nye bar longs spyod par byas te nang de las rab tu grol bar gyur to //🔽de ltar na bcom ldan 'das de byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe na yang sems can rnams kyi don du dka' ba spyad pa rnams mdzad pa de bas na snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de la sems dang bcas pa'i skye
analyzed: de nas skye bo'i tshogs des mtshon cha rnams kyis bcad nas nya ro hi ta de'i sha las blangs nas sman pas bsgo ba'i rim pas nye bar longs spyod par byas te nang de las rab tu grol bar gyur to // de ltar na bcom ldan 'das de byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe na yang sems can rnams kyi don du dka' ba spyad pa rnams mdzad pa de bas na snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de la sems dang bcas pa'i skye
translated: Then the crowd of people, having cut it up with their weapons, took the flesh from the rohita fish and, following the doctor’s instructions, enjoyed it and were completely cured.

original: bo su zhig ces bya ba gus pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: bo su zhig ces bya ba gus pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba'o /
translated: “Thus, even when the Bhagavān was a bodhisattva, he performed austerities for the sake of sentient beings. Therefore, what person with a mind, what devoted person, would not have faith in that Bhagavān who possesses great compassion?”

original: padma can gyi skyes rabs te skyes pa'i rabs brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: padma can gyi skyes rabs te skyes pa'i rabs brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the story of Padmā, the eighth chapter of the Jātakamālā.

original: // / bdag nyid kun nas gdung bar byas kyang ni //
analyzed: // / bdag nyid kun nas gdung bar byas kyang ni //
translated: Even though he was tormented all over,

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu shes pas sbyin pa btang //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu shes pas sbyin pa btang //
translated: he gave gifts, knowing the result of generosity.

original: de ni zhing gi sa la ngal ba ste //
analyzed: de ni zhing gi sa la ngal ba ste //
translated: That was the field’s labor,

original: gang zhig sa bon las ni 'bras bur dad //
analyzed: gang zhig sa bon las ni 'bras bur dad //
translated: Someone believes that the fruit comes from the seed.

original: 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
translated: I heard this story like this:🔽In the palace of the king of Vārāṇasī, the king, by the power of his virtue, having conquered his enemies,

original: b'a r'a na s'i'i rgyal po'i pho brang na tshul gyi stobs kyis pha rol rnam par gnon pas rgyal po'i chogs gzhan dbang du byas pa /
analyzed: b'a r'a na s'i'i rgyal po'i pho brang na tshul gyi stobs kyis pha rol rnam par gnon pas rgyal po'i chogs gzhan dbang du byas pa /
translated: having subjugated the retinues of other kings,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba ltar thogs pa med pa'i 'khor lo can khyad par rnam pa bzhis blon po'i tshogs brtags par byas pa /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba ltar thogs pa med pa'i 'khor lo can khyad par rnam pa bzhis blon po'i tshogs brtags par byas pa /
translated: having an unobstructed wheel like a universal monarch, having a retinue of ministers examined by him in four special ways,

original: thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan nor bu rnams kyi gter don du gnyer ba'i skye bo dang thun mong ba'i dbang phyug dang ldan pa /
analyzed: thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / gtong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan nor bu rnams kyi gter don du gnyer ba'i skye bo dang thun mong ba'i dbang phyug dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with a lordly power shared with the people who seek the treasure of jewels of good qualities such as learning, morality, and generosity,🔽having crossed the ocean to the other side with his fame white like a cut piece of white crystal,

original: nor bu dkar po bcad pa ltar dkar ba'i grags pas rgya mtsho'i pha rol kun nas brgal bar byas pa gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir 'bad pas rtsol ba de dus gcig gi tshe na /
analyzed: nor bu dkar po bcad pa ltar dkar ba'i grags pas rgya mtsho'i pha rol kun nas brgal bar byas pa gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir 'bad pas rtsol ba de dus gcig gi tshe na /
translated: at one time, that king, who was striving with effort for the sake of accomplishing the welfare of others,

original: byang chub chen pa nye bar rgyas par byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshangs pas byin zhes bya ba'i rgyal po byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub chen pa nye bar rgyas par byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshangs pas byin zhes bya ba'i rgyal po byung bar gyur to //
translated: The Bodhisattva, having increased his great enlightenment, became a king named Brahmadatta.

original: su zhig rgud pa bsal byas te //
analyzed: su zhig rgud pa bsal byas te //
translated: Who has removed my misfortune,

original: de ring nor gyis tshim byas gang //
analyzed: de ring nor gyis tshim byas gang //
translated: and today satisfied me with wealth?🔽Who has established me on the path of peace?

original: su zhig zhi ba'i lam la gzhag / gang gi 'di 'dra gnas pa 'byung //🔽bdag nyid srid pa rnam gcod @39a * //
analyzed: su zhig zhi ba'i lam la gzhag / gang gi 'di 'dra gnas pa 'byung // bdag nyid srid pa rnam gcod @39a * //
translated: From whom has this good fortune arisen?

original: phyir ; / lam bzang po la gzhag 'dod de //🔽gzhan don med par gzhan 'ga' ni //
analyzed: phyir ; / lam bzang po la gzhag 'dod de // gzhan don med par gzhan 'ga' ni //
translated: I desire to establish him on the excellent path,🔽so that he may cut off the cycle of existence for himself.🔽The great ones do not act without reason

original: bdag nyid che rnams bya ba med //
analyzed: bdag nyid che rnams bya ba med //
translated: for the sake of others.

original: der yang chos kyi rgyal srid rjes su skyong ba'i rgyal po la dus gcig na mu ge shin tu drag po byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: der yang chos kyi rgyal srid rjes su skyong ba'i rgyal po la dus gcig na mu ge shin tu drag po byung bar gyur to //
translated: There, while the king was ruling his Dharma-realm, a very severe famine occurred one time.

original: rim gyis kyang yul der rab tu srab pa'i chu gter mthong ba gcod pa'i dbang gis kun nas skams pa'i ku ba'i ljon shing chus bkab pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa dang / bang mdzod stong pa'i bug pa nas zhugs pa'i byi ba rnams kyis phyir 'byung bzhin pa'i rab tu srab pa'i s'a lu'i snum pas rtsig pa'i rtsa ba khyab pa dang /
analyzed: rim gyis kyang yul der rab tu srab pa'i chu gter mthong ba gcod pa'i dbang gis kun nas skams pa'i ku ba'i ljon shing chus bkab pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa dang / bang mdzod stong pa'i bug pa nas zhugs pa'i byi ba rnams kyis phyir 'byung bzhin pa'i rab tu srab pa'i s'a lu'i snum pas rtsig pa'i rtsa ba khyab pa dang /
translated: The rats that had entered the empty treasury came out. The foundation of the wall was covered with the oil of very thin rice.🔽The sound of the pestle and the churning stick was not understood. The leaves were covered with steam that was placed on the hearth by the smoke of the poor people who were emaciated by hunger.

original: gtun shing dang srub pa'i sgra ma rtogs pa dang / bkres pas rid pa'i du ba'i skye bos mthong bzhin pa'i sged  po la kun nas gzhag pa'i rlangs pa dang ldan pa'i lo ma'i phung po dang ldan pa dang / don du gnyer ba'i skye bo rnams gyis sgo rnams na lhag par mi gnas pa dang /
analyzed: gtun shing dang srub pa'i sgra ma rtogs pa dang / bkres pas rid pa'i du ba'i skye bos mthong bzhin pa'i sged  po la kun nas gzhag pa'i rlangs pa dang ldan pa'i lo ma'i phung po dang ldan pa dang / don du gnyer ba'i skye bo rnams gyis sgo rnams na lhag par mi gnas pa dang /
translated: The people who were seeking did not remain in the doorways.

original: bu mo rnams kyis btus bzhin pa'i kun nas rnying ba'i lo ma ni lo ma dang ldan pa dang / shi ba las lhag mar gyur pa'i stobs chung ba'i ba glang gi tshogs kyis lhag par gnas par gyur pa'i skams pa dang rab tu chad cing 'grib pa'i ba glang gi tshogs dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: bu mo rnams kyis btus bzhin pa'i kun nas rnying ba'i lo ma ni lo ma dang ldan pa dang / shi ba las lhag mar gyur pa'i stobs chung ba'i ba glang gi tshogs kyis lhag par gnas par gyur pa'i skams pa dang rab tu chad cing 'grib pa'i ba glang gi tshogs dang ldan pa dang /
translated: The girls were gathering old leaves, and the weak cows, left over from those that had died, were standing in the dry, cut, and withered cow pen.

original: mtshan mo mar me dang bral bas zhugs pa'i mun pas bgrod par dka' ba dang / dri ma can dang rnying pa'i gos gyon pa'i dbul ba'i skye bo dang ldan pa dang kha bas phyid pa'i padmo'i nags ltar khyim rnams dpal med pa nyid du song bar gyur to //
analyzed: mtshan mo mar me dang bral bas zhugs pa'i mun pas bgrod par dka' ba dang / dri ma can dang rnying pa'i gos gyon pa'i dbul ba'i skye bo dang ldan pa dang kha bas phyid pa'i padmo'i nags ltar khyim rnams dpal med pa nyid du song bar gyur to //
translated: The poor people, wearing dirty, old clothes, were moving about in the darkness of the night, which was without lamps, and the houses had lost their splendor, like a lotus grove covered with frost.

original: de nas skye bo'i tshogs des kun nas nye bar 'ongs shing rgyal po la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas skye bo'i tshogs des kun nas nye bar 'ongs shing rgyal po la smras pa /
translated: Then the people gathered around and said to the king,

original: 'gro ba'i don du 'bad pa kun nas brtsams pa yis //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don du 'bad pa kun nas brtsams pa yis //
translated: With all your efforts for the sake of the world,

original: brgya byin dang mtshungs sa yi dbang phyug khyod ni yod pa la //
analyzed: brgya byin dang mtshungs sa yi dbang phyug khyod ni yod pa la //
translated: You, lord of the earth, are like Indra.

original: skye bo 'di ni bkres pa'i me yis gdungs pas nyams pa ni //
analyzed: skye bo 'di ni bkres pa'i me yis gdungs pas nyams pa ni //
translated: This person, tormented by the fire of hunger, is emaciated,

original: stobs chung yan lag srog shing ji ltar skams par gyur //
analyzed: stobs chung yan lag srog shing ji ltar skams par gyur //
translated: his limbs weak, his life-force drying up.

original: de nas skye bo de ni dri bcas rnying pa'i gos ldan pa //
analyzed: de nas skye bo de ni dri bcas rnying pa'i gos ldan pa //
translated: Then, that person, wearing old, dirty clothes,

original: 'od ni rtsub pa dregs pas nye bar gdungs shing sdug bsngal pa //
analyzed: 'od ni rtsub pa dregs pas nye bar gdungs shing sdug bsngal pa //
translated: his radiance rough, tormented by pride and suffering,

original: bya ba rnam par bral ba yang dag mthong nas sa bdag ni //
analyzed: bya ba rnam par bral ba yang dag mthong nas sa bdag ni //
translated: seeing the king free from activity,

original: mig dag sdug bsngal gyis ni mchi ma yang dag 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mig dag sdug bsngal gyis ni mchi ma yang dag 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: his eyes well up with tears of sorrow.

original: de nas rgyal po des lo legs pa dus 'di tsam nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba rnam par shes nas bang mdzod @39b nas 'bras so ba'i tshad yongs te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po des lo legs pa dus 'di tsam nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba rnam par shes nas bang mdzod @39b nas 'bras so ba'i tshad yongs te /
translated: Then, the king, knowing that the good harvest would occur at this time, opened the granaries and distributed rice

original: skye bo'i tshogs de la 'bras chang pa re re nyi ma re re zhing byin par gyur to //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs de la 'bras chang pa re re nyi ma re re zhing byin par gyur to //
translated: to the people, giving each person a measure of rice every day.

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang chang pa gnyis mngon par 'tshal bar gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang chang pa gnyis mngon par 'tshal bar gyur ro //
translated: and he himself had two jars filled.

original: skye bo'i grangs 'jug par gyur pa de la bram ze gzhan dag sdod par ma gyur to //
analyzed: skye bo'i grangs 'jug par gyur pa de la bram ze gzhan dag sdod par ma gyur to //
translated: And when the number of people had been fixed, the other Brahmans did not stay.

original: des kyang yun ring po nas gtam de thos nas nye bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: des kyang yun ring po nas gtam de thos nas nye bar 'ongs te /
translated: And he, having heard the news for a long time, came near,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mdun du sdug bsngal gyis yongs su phongs pa'i yi ge 'di smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mdun du sdug bsngal gyis yongs su phongs pa'i yi ge 'di smras so //
translated: and in the presence of the Bodhisattva he spoke this verse, which was full of suffering:

original: rang gi skye bo'i grogs dang rnam bral bas //
analyzed: rang gi skye bo'i grogs dang rnam bral bas //
translated: “Separated from my relatives and friends,

original: 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ma 'ongs pas //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa ma 'ongs pas //
translated: and deprived of the abundance of my desires,

original: sna tshogs rgud pa rnams kyi skyon gyis kyang //
analyzed: sna tshogs rgud pa rnams kyi skyon gyis kyang //
translated: and also by the fault of various misfortunes,

original: kye ma 'gro ba gtam ni mang ba yin //
analyzed: kye ma 'gro ba gtam ni mang ba yin //
translated: alas, the news of the people is much.

original: bstan pa'i sdug bsngal zil gnon pa'i //
analyzed: bstan pa'i sdug bsngal zil gnon pa'i //
translated: The teaching is overcome by suffering,

original: slong ba sdug bsngal chen po'i phyir //
analyzed: slong ba sdug bsngal chen po'i phyir //
translated: and because of the great suffering of the beggars,

original: yun ring lam gyis kun dub pa'i //
analyzed: yun ring lam gyis kun dub pa'i //
translated: and because of the long road that is all around,

original: mdun du ri la 'dzeg pa ltar //
analyzed: mdun du ri la 'dzeg pa ltar //
translated: in front of me it is like climbing a mountain.

original: sdug bsngal bstan pa yid re nga //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bstan pa yid re nga //
translated: The teaching of suffering is so painful!

original: 'bras bu ma thob skye bo ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma thob skye bo ni //
translated: The people who have not attained the fruit,

original: yun ring bya byed 'ching bdag gis //
analyzed: yun ring bya byed 'ching bdag gis //
translated: For a long time, the master of the bonds of action

original: shin tu 'di ni sdug bsngal byed //
analyzed: shin tu 'di ni sdug bsngal byed //
translated: has made this [life] very painful.

original: bde ba'i re ba'i khyim rmongs pas //
analyzed: bde ba'i re ba'i khyim rmongs pas //
translated: The ignorant, in the house of hope for happiness,

original: mthon por 'dzeg pa'i mi rnams la //
analyzed: mthon por 'dzeg pa'i mi rnams la //
translated: for those who climb to the top,

original: sdug bsngal skas rim phreng ba rnams //
analyzed: sdug bsngal skas rim phreng ba rnams //
translated: the series of steps of suffering

original: mdun du 'phel ba nyid du gyur //
analyzed: mdun du 'phel ba nyid du gyur //
translated: become a continuous ascent.

original: 'di ni mi lus sdug bsngal nyid //
analyzed: 'di ni mi lus sdug bsngal nyid //
translated: This is the suffering of the human body.🔽Although it arises, ceases, and is subject to destruction,

original: skye ba dang ldan 'gag pa dang // de lta na yang rmongs rnams la ;
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan 'gag pa dang // de lta na yang rmongs rnams la ;
translated: still, for the ignorant,

original: / bde pa'i 'du shes 'jug par gyur //
analyzed: / bde pa'i 'du shes 'jug par gyur //
translated: the notion of happiness prevails.

original: rmongs pas sems kyi glang po skyon //
analyzed: rmongs pas sems kyi glang po skyon //
translated: The elephant of the mind, due to delusion,

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis lcags kyu dor //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis lcags kyu dor //
translated: throws away the hook of the power of mindfulness.

original: dbang po'i mche ba gnyis rnams kyis //
analyzed: dbang po'i mche ba gnyis rnams kyis //
translated: The two tusks of the senses

original: sdug bsngal rgyu yis rings nas phrogs //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu yis rings nas phrogs //
translated: are quickly seized by the cause of suffering.

original: so ga'i dus kyis gdungs par byas pa'i rma bya yang //
analyzed: so ga'i dus kyis gdungs par byas pa'i rma bya yang //
translated: Even a peacock tormented by the heat of summer

original: sa yi steng du gnas pa'i chu ni 'thung mi byed //
analyzed: sa yi steng du gnas pa'i chu ni 'thung mi byed //
translated: does not drink water that remains on the ground.

original: nam mkha' la 'khor char dus skyes la sdod pa ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'khor char dus skyes la sdod pa ni //
translated: But the one born in the rainy season, dwelling in the sky,

original: khyad par 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal sten byad skye bo yin //
analyzed: khyad par 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal sten byad skye bo yin //
translated: In particular, the people who are to be supported are the cause of suffering.

original: gal te dbang po gcig la gnas par byas par gyur na de nyid la ni sdug bsngal 'byung //
analyzed: gal te dbang po gcig la gnas par byas par gyur na de nyid la ni sdug bsngal 'byung //
translated: If one of the senses is not controlled, suffering will arise from that very [sense].

original: stobs dang ldan pa gcig gis kyang ni khur po chen po khur bor nus pa ma yin te //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa gcig gis kyang ni khur po chen po khur bor nus pa ma yin te //
translated: Even a single strong man cannot carry a very heavy load.

original: de ltar lha yi lam gyi rjes 'brang sdug bsngal shin tu che ba bdag gis rnam bsams nas //
analyzed: de ltar lha yi lam gyi rjes 'brang sdug bsngal shin tu che ba bdag gis rnam bsams nas //
translated: Thus, following the path of the gods, I have contemplated the great suffering.

original: bdag nyid rnam pa du mar khyab bdag nyid kyis byas te dbang po thams cad la ni gnas //
analyzed: bdag nyid rnam pa du mar khyab bdag nyid kyis byas te dbang po thams cad la ni gnas //
translated: I have made myself in many ways the lord of myself, and I abide in all the senses.

original: rgyal bos gsungs pa /🔽bram ze chen po bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal 'di ltar @40a * //
analyzed: rgyal bos gsungs pa / bram ze chen po bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal 'di ltar @40a * //
translated: The king said:

original: yang dang yang du rjes su brjod pa rnams kyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yang dang yang du rjes su brjod pa rnams kyis ci zhig bya //
translated: Great Brahmin, what is the use of repeatedly expressing this suffering of yours?

original: gang gis dgos pa de myur du brjod par gyis shig ces zer ro //
analyzed: gang gis dgos pa de myur du brjod par gyis shig ces zer ro //
translated: Quickly tell me the purpose of this.

original: bram zes smras pa /
analyzed: bram zes smras pa /
translated: The Brahmin said:

original: blangs par ma gyur pa yang lha yi dbang pos ster //
analyzed: blangs par ma gyur pa yang lha yi dbang pos ster //
translated: The Lord of the Gods gives what has not been taken.

original: gtsang zhing mang ba'i chu ni chung ba slong ba la //
analyzed: gtsang zhing mang ba'i chu ni chung ba slong ba la //
translated: The water is pure and abundant, but the beggar is small.

original: de lta na yang mi brtan de ni skad cig slong //
analyzed: de lta na yang mi brtan de ni skad cig slong //
translated: And yet, the unstable one is asking for a moment.🔽The one who is in need is afraid, for what reason?

original: don gnyer skye bo 'jigs pa gang phyir rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: don gnyer skye bo 'jigs pa gang phyir rang bzhin nyid //
translated: The nature itself

original: 'dod pa chung ba bdag yid kyang //
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba bdag yid kyang //
translated: The one who has few desires, my mind also

original: sgrub par byed pa ma tshang bas //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ma tshang bas //
translated: The one who is not complete in practice

original: 'gyod de gus pa ster de bas //
analyzed: 'gyod de gus pa ster de bas //
translated: The one who is regretful, the one who gives respectfully, that is

original: sdom changs gcig ni bdag la rtsol //
analyzed: sdom changs gcig ni bdag la rtsol //
translated: The one who is restrained, the one who is perfect, the one who strives for me

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar rnam par bsams par gyur te //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas 'di ltar rnam par bsams par gyur te //
translated: Then the Bodhisattva thought like this:

original: kye ma 'dod pa chen po nyid ces bya ba sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: kye ma 'dod pa chen po nyid ces bya ba sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ni /
translated: Alas, the great desire itself becomes the reason for all suffering.

original: 'dod pa chung ba la yang dgos pa'i bsam pa ngal bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba la yang dgos pa'i bsam pa ngal bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Even for the one who has few desires, the intention for what is necessary becomes tiring.

original: 'dod pa che ba la ni ngal ba ma spyad lhag par yid ni sdug bsngal byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa che ba la ni ngal ba ma spyad lhag par yid ni sdug bsngal byed //
translated: For the one who has great desire, without engaging in hardship, the mind is made extremely unhappy.

original: me ni khur med pa yang dka' bas sa 'dzin la ni kun nas 'dzeg pa ste //
analyzed: me ni khur med pa yang dka' bas sa 'dzin la ni kun nas 'dzeg pa ste //
translated: The fire, even without a load, is difficult to climb up to the earth that holds everything.

original: phrag par bkod pa'i che shing lci ba'i khur bus rab tu gnon pa smos ci dgos //
analyzed: phrag par bkod pa'i che shing lci ba'i khur bus rab tu gnon pa smos ci dgos //
translated: What need is there to mention the heavy burden of the great tree placed on his shoulders?

original: de nas rnam par bsams nas rgyal po des bram ze de la nyi ma re re zhing bdag nyid kyi kham gnyis po de las kham gcig byin par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas rnam par bsams nas rgyal po des bram ze de la nyi ma re re zhing bdag nyid kyi kham gnyis po de las kham gcig byin par gyur to //
translated: Then, having reflected, the king gave to the brahmin half of his daily portion, one of the two mouthfuls.

original: kham gcig zos pa de'i de nyid du yid tshim zhing rnam par bzhugs par gyur to //
analyzed: kham gcig zos pa de'i de nyid du yid tshim zhing rnam par bzhugs par gyur to //
translated: Having eaten one mouthful, he remained there satisfied.

original: de nas blon po rnams kyis rgyal po de la ngo mtshar ba dang bcas pas 'di skad ces smras par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas blon po rnams kyis rgyal po de la ngo mtshar ba dang bcas pas 'di skad ces smras par gyur to //
translated: Then the ministers, with astonishment, said this to the king:

original: ae me kham gcig zos pas kyang lha'i lus la stobs dang 'od rnams 'grib par ma gyur to //
analyzed: ae me kham gcig zos pas kyang lha'i lus la stobs dang 'od rnams 'grib par ma gyur to //
translated: “Oh! Even by eating one mouthful, the strength and radiance of the divine body have not diminished!”

original: rgyal pos gsungs pa /

translated: He shook off the dust of the grass blades from his body with his tongue, and with his mind following the herd of deer, he went to the city of Vārāṇasī.

original: de nas me tog phye ma 'bras bu rnams kyis khyab //
analyzed: de nas me tog phye ma 'bras bu rnams kyis khyab //
translated: Then, covered with flowers, pollen, and fruits,

original: rnam khyab bung ba rnams kyi skad kyis khyab pa dang // rlung gi yal ga'i rtse mo'i lag pa g-yob pa yis //
analyzed: rnam khyab bung ba rnams kyi skad kyis khyab pa dang // rlung gi yal ga'i rtse mo'i lag pa g-yob pa yis //
translated: The whole place is filled with the songs of bees, and the trees, with their branches waving in the wind,🔽seem to be trying to turn him back.

original: ri shing rnams kyang de las zlog par byed ltar 'dug / grogs ltar ri dags des ni rnam par grol bzhin pa //
analyzed: ri shing rnams kyang de las zlog par byed ltar 'dug / grogs ltar ri dags des ni rnam par grol bzhin pa //
translated: The deer, as if it were his friend, is leading him to freedom,

original: rlung gis gdungs shing g-yo ba yi ni 'dab ma can //
analyzed: rlung gis gdungs shing g-yo ba yi ni 'dab ma can //
translated: while the wind, as if it were a fan, is fanning him,

original: kun nas rnam par khyab pa'i shing bye'u skad ldan pa //
analyzed: kun nas rnam par khyab pa'i shing bye'u skad ldan pa //
translated: and the trees, with their leaves trembling all around, are singing out to him.

original: blta zhing lta bar byed pa'i nags ni du ba 'dra //
analyzed: blta zhing lta bar byed pa'i nags ni du ba 'dra //
translated: The forest, as if it were a guide, is showing him the way.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' b'a r'a na s'i dang nye bar 'ongs te cung zad thogs pas ri dags kyi tshogs de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' b'a r'a na s'i dang nye bar 'ongs te cung zad thogs pas ri dags kyi tshogs de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, having come near to Vārāṇasī, stopped for a while and said to the herd of deer:

original: da ni khyed rnams log par mdzod cig dang gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa dang yang dag par 'brel pa rnams ni rnam par sbyor ba rnyed par sla ba'o ;
analyzed: da ni khyed rnams log par mdzod cig dang gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa dang yang dag par 'brel pa rnams ni rnam par sbyor ba rnyed par sla ba'o ;
translated: “Now you may go back, for it is easy for those who are connected with the world to find an opportunity to serve.

original: / shin tu yun ring por yang dpyid ka'i dus na nyams dga' ba'i autpa la'i tshogs la brten nas kha ba'i dus kyi kun nas rnying ba'i 'dab ma ze 'bru'i lte ba can dri dang bral ba spangs nas rang bzhin gyi g-yo ba'i dpal 'gro ba kho na🔽ste / char pa'i dus kyi chu gter ba'i snam bus 'khrigs pa'i @49a * //
analyzed: / shin tu yun ring por yang dpyid ka'i dus na nyams dga' ba'i autpa la'i tshogs la brten nas kha ba'i dus kyi kun nas rnying ba'i 'dab ma ze 'bru'i lte ba can dri dang bral ba spangs nas rang bzhin gyi g-yo ba'i dpal 'gro ba kho na ste / char pa'i dus kyi chu gter ba'i snam bus 'khrigs pa'i @49a * //
translated: For a very long time, in the spring season, the lotus-ponds, which are delightful, are surrounded by a multitude of lotuses. But in the winter season, the old leaves, which are without fragrance, are cast off, and the glory of their natural movement goes away.🔽The faces of the women of the directions, which are covered with the cloth of the water of the rainy season,

original: phyogs kyi bud med kyi bzhin rnams kun nas snang bar byas te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi bud med kyi bzhin rnams kun nas snang bar byas te /
translated: are made to appear all around.

original: gar byed pa dang 'dra bar bstan par byas nas ston ka'i dus na chu rnam par dor bas yang ba'i chu 'dzin pa rnams la chags pa dang bral ba'i smad 'tshong ma'i bud med rnams kyis yun ring po ma yin pa'i 'od tshogs pa dang bral ba'i chags🔽pa can dang 'dra bar yongs su gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: gar byed pa dang 'dra bar bstan par byas nas ston ka'i dus na chu rnam par dor bas yang ba'i chu 'dzin pa rnams la chags pa dang bral ba'i smad 'tshong ma'i bud med rnams kyis yun ring po ma yin pa'i 'od tshogs pa dang bral ba'i chags🔽pa can dang 'dra bar yongs su gtong bar byed do //
translated: Having been made to dance, as it were, in the autumn season, the clouds, which are light because the water has been removed, are given up by the courtesan women, who are free from attachment, just as a lover is given up after a short time.

original: mtshan mo'i gdong la khyad par du byed pa'i bsil ba'i 'od zer can yang tho rangs kyi dus na lhan cig skyes pa'i 'od kyis yongs su dor bar byed de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad dang 'gro ba la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i gdong la khyad par du byed pa'i bsil ba'i 'od zer can yang tho rangs kyi dus na lhan cig skyes pa'i 'od kyis yongs su dor bar byed de rnam pa thams cad du cung zad dang 'gro ba la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The cool-rayed moon, which is especially beautiful at night, is abandoned at dawn by the light of the rising sun. It is not at all the case that it exists in any way for the world.

original: gang zhig phan tshun du rnam par bral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas /
analyzed: gang zhig phan tshun du rnam par bral bar 'gyur zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas /
translated: Thinking, “Who will be separated from whom?”

original: chos la rtse gcig pa'i khyed rnams kyi gnas nas yang dag par bdag nyid yongs su skyo bar bya zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos la rtse gcig pa'i khyed rnams kyi gnas nas yang dag par bdag nyid yongs su skyo bar bya zhes zer ro //
translated: “You who are one-pointed in the Dharma, leave this place and save yourselves!”

original: ri dags kyi tshogs de yang 'dug nas byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid mig gi yul du 'gro bzhin par mthong ste pha dang bral ba 'dra bar mya ngan gyi zug rdus snying stobs shing zad pa dang 'dra bas nags der so sor 'gro bar gyur to //
analyzed: ri dags kyi tshogs de yang 'dug nas byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid mig gi yul du 'gro bzhin par mthong ste pha dang bral ba 'dra bar mya ngan gyi zug rdus snying stobs shing zad pa dang 'dra bas nags der so sor 'gro bar gyur to //
translated: The herd of deer sat down and saw the Bodhisattva going to the realm of the eyes. They were as if their hearts were pierced by the pain of grief, as if they had lost their father. They went off in all directions in the forest.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang ri dags dang / phag dang ma he dang lug rnams kyi rus pa'i tshogs la 'byar ba'i tshogs kyi ku cos 'jigs su rung ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang ri dags dang / phag dang ma he dang lug rnams kyi rus pa'i tshogs la 'byar ba'i tshogs kyi ku cos 'jigs su rung ba /
translated: The Bodhisattva, too, went to the place where the animals were slaughtered, a place terrifying with the cries of the animals being slaughtered,🔽covered with flies buzzing around the flesh and blood,

original: 'phur zhing nye bar 'brel ba'i sbrang bu rnams kyis sha dang chu rgyus khyab pa gri rnon po nye bar gzhag cing ri dags 'ong ba la sdod pa'i shan pa rnams kyis khyab pa'i phyugs gsod pa'i gnas su phyin nas gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: 'phur zhing nye bar 'brel ba'i sbrang bu rnams kyis sha dang chu rgyus khyab pa gri rnon po nye bar gzhag cing ri dags 'ong ba la sdod pa'i shan pa rnams kyis khyab pa'i phyugs gsod pa'i gnas su phyin nas gnas par gyur to //
translated: with butchers standing around with sharp knives, waiting for the animals to come in.

original: de gsod pa la dbang du byed pa'i skyes bu de rnams kyis kyang tshogs kyi bdag po blangs nas rgyal po la ston cing 'dug go //
analyzed: de gsod pa la dbang du byed pa'i skyes bu de rnams kyis kyang tshogs kyi bdag po blangs nas rgyal po la ston cing 'dug go //
translated: The men who were in charge of killing the animals had already taken the chief of the herd and were showing him to the king.

original: rgyal po ri dags mig 'dra bas //
analyzed: rgyal po ri dags mig 'dra bas //
translated: The king, whose eyes were like those of a deer,

original: de nas ri dags de la smras //🔽yongs su mi zad tshogs khyod ni //
analyzed: de nas ri dags de la smras // yongs su mi zad tshogs khyod ni //
translated: then said to the deer:🔽“Why have you come here

original: ci phyir rang nyid kyis 'ongs smros //
analyzed: ci phyir rang nyid kyis 'ongs smros //
translated: on your own, O herd of inexhaustible life?”

original: byang chub sems dpas smras pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas smras pa //
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: lha lags sbrum ma'i ri dags mo //
analyzed: lha lags sbrum ma'i ri dags mo //
translated: “Your Majesty, there is a pregnant doe

original: bdag la skyabs su nyer song ba //
analyzed: bdag la skyabs su nyer song ba //
translated: And have come to me for refuge,🔽

original: de yi re mos bdag 'ongs so //
analyzed: de yi re mos bdag 'ongs so //
translated: I have come here to fulfill his wish.🔽The man who is overcome by desire

original: bu ni mthong bar 'dod pa yis //🔽'dod chags mi de'i yid ra ba //
analyzed: bu ni mthong bar 'dod pa yis // 'dod chags mi de'i yid ra ba //
translated: and wants to see his son,🔽having fulfilled his desire,

original: rdzogs par byas nas mchog dga' ba //🔽bdag ni 'chi bdag dga' ston 'dod //🔽ri dags mo yang ri dags 'dir //
analyzed: rdzogs par byas nas mchog dga' ba // bdag ni 'chi bdag dga' ston 'dod // ri dags mo yang ri dags 'dir //
translated: will rejoice and be happy.🔽The doe, seeing her mate

original: shi ba'i don du 'gro mthong ba //🔽gang zhig bdag la sdug @49b bsngal gyur //
analyzed: shi ba'i don du 'gro mthong ba // gang zhig bdag la sdug @49b bsngal gyur //
translated: lying dead on the ground,🔽will not experience the suffering

original: de ni de ring 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de ring 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: that I am experiencing now.

original: de phyir nga ni dbang phyug bdag kyang mjal bar mdzod //
analyzed: de phyir nga ni dbang phyug bdag kyang mjal bar mdzod //
translated: Therefore, I will go to meet the Lord of Death.

original: shan pa rnams kyis lha lags gsungs shig ci yi phyir ni 'gor //
analyzed: shan pa rnams kyis lha lags gsungs shig ci yi phyir ni 'gor //
translated: Butchers, tell me why you are late.

original: shin tu yangs pa'i snying rje'i go chas bcings par 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: shin tu yangs pa'i snying rje'i go chas bcings par 'byung ba ni //
translated: I am bound by the armor of vast compassion,

original: bdag gi sems 'di sdug bsngal mda' yis phigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi sems 'di sdug bsngal mda' yis phigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and my mind is not pierced by the arrow of suffering.

original: de nas rgyal po de de'i gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa la mkhas pa de snying brtse rnam par bsams te ngo mtshar ba blos ngo mtshar ba nye bar thob pa dang 'dra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la smras pa //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de de'i gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa la mkhas pa de snying brtse rnam par bsams te ngo mtshar ba blos ngo mtshar ba nye bar thob pa dang 'dra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la smras pa //
translated: Then the king, thinking of his skill in accomplishing the welfare of others, and filled with compassion, said to the Bodhisattva, who was like a wonder that had been accomplished by the power of his own mind:

original: tshogs kyi bdag po legs so //
analyzed: tshogs kyi bdag po legs so //
translated: “Excellent, lord of the assembly!

original: gzhan don bsgrub pa la ni nges par 'brel ba'i sems //
analyzed: gzhan don bsgrub pa la ni nges par 'brel ba'i sems //
translated: Your mind is certainly devoted to accomplishing the welfare of others.

original: ri dags gzugs can rnams ni skyes bu rnams kyi mchog / gzhan la gnod phyir 'bad pa nges par 'brel ba ni //
analyzed: ri dags gzugs can rnams ni skyes bu rnams kyi mchog / gzhan la gnod phyir 'bad pa nges par 'brel ba ni //
translated: Those who have the form of deer are the best of men.

original: kho bo cag ni sbrul dang ri dags rnams dang mtshungs //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni sbrul dang ri dags rnams dang mtshungs //
translated: But I am like a snake or a deer,🔽for I am certainly devoted to striving to harm others.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas rgyal po 'gyod pa dang bcas par shes nas dbugs 'byin zhing bde ba skyes pa la 'di skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas rgyal po 'gyod pa dang bcas par shes nas dbugs 'byin zhing bde ba skyes pa la 'di skad ces gsungs so //
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, knowing that the king was filled with remorse, spoke to him, comforting him and bringing him joy:

original: nongs pa byas pa skyabs su nye bar song ba ste //
analyzed: nongs pa byas pa skyabs su nye bar song ba ste //
translated: “Those who have done wrong and have come to you for protection,

original: dgra yang khro ba rnam par spangs nas khyed kyis bsrungs //
analyzed: dgra yang khro ba rnam par spangs nas khyed kyis bsrungs //
translated: even enemies, you have protected, having given up anger.

original: nongs pa med pa'i ri dags rnams kyi steng du ni //
analyzed: nongs pa med pa'i ri dags rnams kyi steng du ni //
translated: But not on those who are innocent, the deer.

original: khyod kyi rno ba'i mda' rnams ji ltar btang ste smos //🔽rgyab phyogs ldang ba la yang ni //
analyzed: khyod kyi rno ba'i mda' rnams ji ltar btang ste smos // rgyab phyogs ldang ba la yang ni //
translated: How could you shoot your sharp arrows at innocent deer?🔽You did not strike those who rose up behind you

original: g-yul ngor khyod kyis ma brdegs te //🔽'jigs pas skrag pa'i nyams bzhin pa'i //🔽ri dags rnams la ji ltar brdeg / kun rtog yang dag min pas 'phel //
analyzed: g-yul ngor khyod kyis ma brdegs te // 'jigs pas skrag pa'i nyams bzhin pa'i // ri dags rnams la ji ltar brdeg / kun rtog yang dag min pas 'phel //
translated: in the battle,🔽so how could you strike deer🔽who were frightened and terrified?

original: ri dags shor ba btang bar gyis //🔽'phro ba'i 'od ldan dmyal me la //
analyzed: ri dags shor ba btang bar gyis // 'phro ba'i 'od ldan dmyal me la //
translated: Let the deer go, for they are increased by the false imagination.🔽What oblation will be offered to the fire of hell,

original: gang zhig sreg blugs 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zhig sreg blugs 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: which is ablaze with the light of its own flames?

original: de nas rgyal po de yid rab tu dga' bas tshogs kyi bdag po de seng ge'i khri la 'dug tu bcug nas gus pa dang bcas pas dma' ba'i stan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de yid rab tu dga' bas tshogs kyi bdag po de seng ge'i khri la 'dug tu bcug nas gus pa dang bcas pas dma' ba'i stan la 'dug ste /
translated: Then the king, with a delighted mind, made the lord of the assembly sit on a lion throne, and himself sat on a low seat with respect.

original: ae ma'o legs par bshad pa gti mug gi rab rib sel bar byed pa'i chos bstan pa bdag la mdzod cig bya bar rab tu smras par gyur to //
analyzed: ae ma'o legs par bshad pa gti mug gi rab rib sel bar byed pa'i chos bstan pa bdag la mdzod cig bya bar rab tu smras par gyur to //
translated: He said, Oh! Please teach the Dharma that removes the darkness of delusion and is well-spoken.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rgyal po 'khor ma lus pas lta bar gyur pa rgyal po de la rten par byed cing 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' rgyal po 'khor ma lus pas lta bar gyur pa rgyal po de la rten par byed cing 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, the king, who was being looked at by the entire retinue, spoke to the king, saying:

original: legs par bshad pas dga' ba dpal gyi nga rgyal med //
analyzed: legs par bshad pas dga' ba dpal gyi nga rgyal med //
translated: “You are not proud of your glory, which is the joy of good advice;

original: gzhan don bsgrub la shin tu mkhas pa'i bya ba can //
analyzed: gzhan don bsgrub la shin tu mkhas pa'i bya ba can //
translated: You are skilled in the performance of the benefit of others;

original: yon tan rnams kyis tshim med yon tan ldan rnams gus /
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyis tshim med yon tan ldan rnams gus /
translated: You are not satisfied with your own virtues, and you respect those who have virtues;

original: @50a * // bdag nyid chen po rnams kyi spyod pa 'di ni grags //
analyzed: @50a * // bdag nyid chen po rnams kyi spyod pa 'di ni grags //
translated: This is the conduct of the great ones, which is well known.

original: shin tu gsal bar byas pa'i mtho ba'i gzi brjid can //
analyzed: shin tu gsal bar byas pa'i mtho ba'i gzi brjid can //
translated: You are endowed with a lofty splendor, which is well illuminated;

original: mi la mi yi mtshan ma gnyis yin te //
analyzed: mi la mi yi mtshan ma gnyis yin te //
translated: There are two marks of a human being:🔽Respect for the mind, which is the absence of poverty even in misfortune;

original: sems la gus pas rgud pa rnams kyang phongs med dang // 'phags pa'i lam ni gsal bar byed pa'i khrel yod kyang ;
analyzed: sems la gus pas rgud pa rnams kyang phongs med dang // 'phags pa'i lam ni gsal bar byed pa'i khrel yod kyang ;
translated: And shame, which is the illumination of the path of the noble ones.

original: / skye ngan rang bzhin nyid kyis bsam pa dri mar bcas //
analyzed: / skye ngan rang bzhin nyid kyis bsam pa dri mar bcas //
translated: But the wicked are naturally defiled in their thoughts;

original: don med gzhan gyi grags pa min la sems brtse byed //
analyzed: don med gzhan gyi grags pa min la sems brtse byed //
translated: They are not interested in the glory of others, which is not their own.

original: rang sems dag pa la ni rnam par zhugs pa'i blo //
analyzed: rang sems dag pa la ni rnam par zhugs pa'i blo //
translated: The mind of the wise enters into the purity of its own heart.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni de la'ang shin tu brtse bar ldan //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni de la'ang shin tu brtse bar ldan //
translated: And they are full of love for it.

original: skyes bu'i bya ba 'dra bar byung ba'i mi rnams la //
analyzed: skyes bu'i bya ba 'dra bar byung ba'i mi rnams la //
translated: The people who have come into the world like a play of men

original: bya ba kun ni gzhan la phan par byed pa min //
analyzed: bya ba kun ni gzhan la phan par byed pa min //
translated: Do not perform all their actions for the benefit of others.

original: kun nas 'phros pa'i 'od kyi sprin bral nam mkha' la //
analyzed: kun nas 'phros pa'i 'od kyi sprin bral nam mkha' la //
translated: In the sky, free from the clouds of the light that spreads around,

original: aa ka sti nyid dug dang bral ba'i chu ni byed //
analyzed: aa ka sti nyid dug dang bral ba'i chu ni byed //
translated: The water of the akasha is made free from poison.

original: dam pa'i skye bo dam pa'i spyod pa 'phro ba yis //
analyzed: dam pa'i skye bo dam pa'i spyod pa 'phro ba yis //
translated: The good people, by the spreading of the good conduct,

original: rnam par bsams bzhin pa yang ngo mtshar skyed par byed //
analyzed: rnam par bsams bzhin pa yang ngo mtshar skyed par byed //
translated: Cause wonder even in those who are full of thoughts.

original: gang tshe lus can rnams la mig gi lam du 'gro //
analyzed: gang tshe lus can rnams la mig gi lam du 'gro //
translated: When they go in the path of the eyes of the embodied ones,

original: de tshe bdud rtsi bzhin du yid rnams la ni gtor //
analyzed: de tshe bdud rtsi bzhin du yid rnams la ni gtor //
translated: Then they are scattered on the minds like nectar.

original: gang gi ma 'ongs pa na gzhan la phan pa'i chu rgyun rnam par 'chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi ma 'ongs pa na gzhan la phan pa'i chu rgyun rnam par 'chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The stream of water that is for the benefit of others in the future is not cut off.

original: gang gi blo yi mig ni mun pa rnam bral de dag gnyis gnyid sad par byed //
analyzed: gang gi blo yi mig ni mun pa rnam bral de dag gnyis gnyid sad par byed //
translated: Those whose eyes of mind are free from darkness, they awaken the two.

original: gzhan rnams nyid ni phyugs kyi chos can gzhan la phan pa bya ba la ni dman pa'i blo //
analyzed: gzhan rnams nyid ni phyugs kyi chos can gzhan la phan pa bya ba la ni dman pa'i blo //
translated: The others are devoted to the dharma of cattle, and are of low intelligence in the matter of benefiting others.

original: bag med yid can mi shes gnyis dang ldan pa rnams la nyin dang mtshan mo dag ni mnyam //
analyzed: bag med yid can mi shes gnyis dang ldan pa rnams la nyin dang mtshan mo dag ni mnyam //
translated: For them, day and night are the same, their minds are careless, and they are endowed with the two kinds of ignorance.

original: 'khor bar 'khor bar byed cing mun nag chen po la ni kun nas gnas par byed bzhin nam //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'khor bar byed cing mun nag chen po la ni kun nas gnas par byed bzhin nam //
translated: They are engaged in wandering through saṃsāra, and they abide in great darkness.

original: dam pa la ni 'bras bu bsags pa shin tu che ba bdag gi chad pa rnam gnyis yin ;
analyzed: dam pa la ni 'bras bu bsags pa shin tu che ba bdag gi chad pa rnam gnyis yin ;
translated: For the holy ones, the two kinds of loss are very great, and the accumulation of the fruit is great.

original: / gang zhig khyim ni spangs nas legs pa'i don du dka' thub nags la mngon par gnas byed pa //
analyzed: / gang zhig khyim ni spangs nas legs pa'i don du dka' thub nags la mngon par gnas byed pa //
translated: He who, having renounced his home, properly dwells in the forest of asceticism for the sake of the good

original: gang la yang ni rnam par dben pa la mkhas mkhas pa rnams dang lhan cig gtam byed pa //
analyzed: gang la yang ni rnam par dben pa la mkhas mkhas pa rnams dang lhan cig gtam byed pa //
translated: and who converses with the wise who are skilled in complete seclusion,

original: gang gi phun tshogs bde bar rang khyim gnas pa bzhin du don gnyer rnams kyi longs spyod de //
analyzed: gang gi phun tshogs bde bar rang khyim gnas pa bzhin du don gnyer rnams kyi longs spyod de //
translated: his prosperity is enjoyed by those in need as if it were their own home.

original: mun pa rab tu 'joms phyir gang gi blo yang gsal bar de dag gnyis nyid 'tsho ba ste //
analyzed: mun pa rab tu 'joms phyir gang gi blo yang gsal bar de dag gnyis nyid 'tsho ba ste //
translated: Because he destroys darkness, his mind is clear, and he lives the double life.

original: gang zhig tshogs pa mthong ba la yang bdag nyid mkhas pa nyid dang bral ba yang //
analyzed: gang zhig tshogs pa mthong ba la yang bdag nyid mkhas pa nyid dang bral ba yang //
translated: He who is seen in the company of the wise, but is himself devoid of wisdom,

original: bris pa'i nor bu ltar ni gzugs 'dzin de yi yod pa nyid kyang nges par med pa nyid //
analyzed: bris pa'i nor bu ltar ni gzugs 'dzin de yi yod pa nyid kyang nges par med pa nyid //
translated: Is like a painted gem, which has the appearance, but not the value, of the gem.

original: dka' bas rnyed pa @50b yang ni rim gyis bde ba slar ni rab tu 'jig par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: dka' bas rnyed pa @50b yang ni rim gyis bde ba slar ni rab tu 'jig par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Wealth, which is acquired with difficulty, is gradually dissipated in pleasure;

original: de 'jig pa las skyes bu bsam pa'i me ni 'bar bar byed cing kun nas gdung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de 'jig pa las skyes bu bsam pa'i me ni 'bar bar byed cing kun nas gdung bar 'gyur //
translated: And the fire of grief, kindled by its loss, consumes the heart.

original: sdug bsngal 'di yis srid pa rjes su 'brel ba skyed byed g-yo sgyu'i dra ba can ni rgyu //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di yis srid pa rjes su 'brel ba skyed byed g-yo sgyu'i dra ba can ni rgyu //
translated: This sorrow is the cause of the web of deceit, which is woven in the pursuit of worldly goods.

original: de rnams shin tu bde ldan gang gis yid rnams la ni chung 'dod yang ngag tu ni gtad //
analyzed: de rnams shin tu bde ldan gang gis yid rnams la ni chung 'dod yang ngag tu ni gtad //
translated: By what means can the mind be made to desire little, and the tongue to speak the truth?

original: gti mug gcod pa'i legs par bshad pa 'bad pa med nyid rdzas ni ster bar byed //
analyzed: gti mug gcod pa'i legs par bshad pa 'bad pa med nyid rdzas ni ster bar byed //
translated: The true expounder of the doctrine, who cuts through the net of error, bestows wealth without toil.

original: rdzas med pa ni gsal ba'i tshig ldan ngag rnams don med par ni 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: rdzas med pa ni gsal ba'i tshig ldan ngag rnams don med par ni 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The man who has no wealth, but is eloquent of speech, is like a broken lute, which only tinkles.

original: bzo bo mkhas pas kyang ni sprin bral nam mkha' dang ni aindra n'i la'i mdog 'dra ba'i /
analyzed: bzo bo mkhas pas kyang ni sprin bral nam mkha' dang ni aindra n'i la'i mdog 'dra ba'i /
translated: Even a skilled artist cannot paint a picture of it,🔽For it is like the sky free of clouds or the color of sapphire.

original: dpal gyi snying po byed de dri mas rtsub pa'i dril bur bcas pa'i lcags kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: dpal gyi snying po byed de dri mas rtsub pa'i dril bur bcas pa'i lcags kyis ma yin no //
translated: Even a skilled craftsman does not make a glorious heart out of a bell-metal that is rough with impurities, but out of the color of the cloudless sky or of sapphire.

original: de ltar yon tan dang yon tan ma yin pa'i bye brag shes pa'i rgyal po chen pos dam pa'i lam la brten nas gnas par bya zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan dang yon tan ma yin pa'i bye brag shes pa'i rgyal po chen pos dam pa'i lam la brten nas gnas par bya zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, O great king, knowing the difference between virtue and vice, you should live by relying on the path of the good.

original: de nas rgyal po de chos kyi gtam gyi bdud rtsi myang bas tshim pa'i yid ri dags rnams la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa gus pa dang bcas pas 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' la bsngags par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de chos kyi gtam gyi bdud rtsi myang bas tshim pa'i yid ri dags rnams la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa gus pa dang bcas pas 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' la bsngags par gyur to //
translated: Then, the king, his mind satisfied by the taste of the nectar of the Dharma, respectfully gave freedom from fear to the deer and praised the Bodhisattva in this way:

original: skye ba yod na 'jig rten 'di ni 'chi dang na ba'i ngal ba rnams kyis gnod pa ste //
analyzed: skye ba yod na 'jig rten 'di ni 'chi dang na ba'i ngal ba rnams kyis gnod pa ste //
translated: “When there is birth, this world is afflicted by the troubles of death and sickness.

original: srid pa'i rgyun gyis nges par bcings pa'i 'gro ba la ni slar yang de nyid sems kyi nad //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun gyis nges par bcings pa'i 'gro ba la ni slar yang de nyid sems kyi nad //
translated: The mind is again afflicted by that very thing in the world, which is bound by the continuity of existence.”

original: de lta srid pa gzhan gyi rab tu 'jigs pa chad pa'i 'khor ba mya ngan 'das pa'i mthar //
analyzed: de lta srid pa gzhan gyi rab tu 'jigs pa chad pa'i 'khor ba mya ngan 'das pa'i mthar //
translated: Thus, the other world is the terrible severance of the cycle of death and rebirth.

original: khyed cag yang dag 'brel pa'i rgyu zhes rtog pa skyon dang bcas pa 'di yang bdag cag la'o //
analyzed: khyed cag yang dag 'brel pa'i rgyu zhes rtog pa skyon dang bcas pa 'di yang bdag cag la'o //
translated: This faulty conception of yours, that there is a cause for the connection of the soul and body, is also ours.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de seng ge'i khri las babs nas rgyal po la dris par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de seng ge'i khri las babs nas rgyal po la dris par gyur to //
translated: Then the Bodhisattva descended from the lion-throne and questioned the king.

original: mi yi mchog lags bdag ni med par yid mi bde bas ni //
analyzed: mi yi mchog lags bdag ni med par yid mi bde bas ni //
translated: O best of men, I am not at ease without you.

original: kun nas khyab pa'i ri dags tshogs ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: kun nas khyab pa'i ri dags tshogs ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The whole herd of deer will be scattered.

original: yun ring por ni tsher ma med par sa ni rjes su skyong //
analyzed: yun ring por ni tsher ma med par sa ni rjes su skyong //
translated: For a long time the land will be protected without thorns.

original: de nas gan du gom pa rings par bdag ni 'gro bar bgyi //
analyzed: de nas gan du gom pa rings par bdag ni 'gro bar bgyi //
translated: Then I will go to you quickly.

original: de nas tshogs kyi bdag po de sa skyong bas rjes su gnang bas nags de nyid du kun nas 'ongs par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas tshogs kyi bdag po de sa skyong bas rjes su gnang bas nags de nyid du kun nas 'ongs par gyur to //
translated: Then the Lord of the Herd, having been permitted by the king of the earth, came back to the forest.

original: de nas tshogs kyi bdag po ring po nas mthong ste //
analyzed: de nas tshogs kyi bdag po ring po nas mthong ste //
translated: Then the Lord of the Herd saw him from a distance.

original: ri dags tshogs de dga' bas phrad 'dod mig ldan pa //
analyzed: ri dags tshogs de dga' bas phrad 'dod mig ldan pa //
translated: The herd of deer, with eyes longing to meet him,

original: so rtses rtsva sar dang ni ku sha 'dzin byed pa //
analyzed: so rtses rtsva sar dang ni ku sha 'dzin byed pa //
translated: with teeth and claws holding grass and kuśa,

original: gral ni zhig ste myur du mdun nas bsus par gyur //🔽gang zhig rnam par btsum @51a * //
analyzed: gral ni zhig ste myur du mdun nas bsus par gyur // gang zhig rnam par btsum @51a * //
translated: broke ranks and quickly came to greet him from the front.🔽He who was like one with eyes half-closed,

original: byas mig dang 'dra ba yod 'gyur ba //
analyzed: byas mig dang 'dra ba yod 'gyur ba //
translated: now with eyes wide open,

original: ri dags mos ni tshogs bdag nags mtha' nas song ba //
analyzed: ri dags mos ni tshogs bdag nags mtha' nas song ba //
translated: the deer approached the lord of the herd from the edge of the forest.

original: brtan pa der ni kun nas 'ongs pa de nyid ni //
analyzed: brtan pa der ni kun nas 'ongs pa de nyid ni //
translated: That very one who had come all around the steadfast one,

original: slar yang mig ni phye ba 'dra bar song ba'o //
analyzed: slar yang mig ni phye ba 'dra bar song ba'o //
translated: now went as if opening his eyes again.

original: de nas ri dags gtso bo la ni ri dags mo 'ongs nas //
analyzed: de nas ri dags gtso bo la ni ri dags mo 'ongs nas //
translated: Then the doe came to the lord of the deer,

original: dga' ba bskyed cing yangs pa'i mig can 'di skad ces ni smras //
analyzed: dga' ba bskyed cing yangs pa'i mig can 'di skad ces ni smras //
translated: and with joyful eyes, she spoke thus:

original: bdag gi yid ni bde bar byed cing phrug gu 'di nags su //
analyzed: bdag gi yid ni bde bar byed cing phrug gu 'di nags su //
translated: My mind is delighted, and this fawn

original: ri dags mgon po khyod kyi drin gyis kun nas rol bar byed //
analyzed: ri dags mgon po khyod kyi drin gyis kun nas rol bar byed //
translated: in the forest, O lord of the deer, is playing all around through your kindness.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang ri dags kyi khyu gnyis po de la dbugs dbyung bar byas nas mchog tu dga' ba nye bar song bar gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang ri dags kyi khyu gnyis po de la dbugs dbyung bar byas nas mchog tu dga' ba nye bar song bar gyur to //
translated: The Bodhisattva, having given relief to the two herds of deer, was filled with the highest joy.

original: de ltar na gzhan dag la phan pa la rtse gcig pa'i bcom ldan 'das de dud 'gror gyur pa na yang yod par gyur to zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas de la dang ba nye bar bskyed pa la khyed cag gis kyang gnas par gyis shig ces
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan dag la phan pa la rtse gcig pa'i bcom ldan 'das de dud 'gror gyur pa na yang yod par gyur to zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas de la dang ba nye bar bskyed pa la khyed cag gis kyang gnas par gyis shig ces
translated: Thus, even when he was an animal, the Blessed One, who is single-minded in helping others, existed.  Reflecting in this way, you should generate faith in him and abide by it.

original: bya'o // ri dags kyi skyes pa'i rabs te skyes pa'i rabs dang po'o /
analyzed: bya'o // ri dags kyi skyes pa'i rabs te skyes pa'i rabs dang po'o /
translated: This is the first chapter, on the Jataka of the Deer, from the Jataka-mālā.

original: // / tshul khrims yongs su skyong bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: // / tshul khrims yongs su skyong bar byed pa ni //
translated: He who protects morality

original: rma byar gyur pas sems can rnams bskyangs te //🔽srog las 'jigs las gang zhig sngon de la //
analyzed: rma byar gyur pas sems can rnams bskyangs te // srog las 'jigs las gang zhig sngon de la //
translated: as a peacock protected living beings.🔽Who would not generate faith in that man

original: mi ni gang zhig dad pa skyed mi byed //
analyzed: mi ni gang zhig dad pa skyed mi byed //
translated: who previously gave up his life for others?

original: 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
translated: Thus I have heard:

original: dri zhim pa'i padma'i nags kyis khebs pa'i dri ma med pa'i chu chen pos grub pa thob pa'i skye bo'i yid rab tu bde bar byas pa /
analyzed: dri zhim pa'i padma'i nags kyis khebs pa'i dri ma med pa'i chu chen pos grub pa thob pa'i skye bo'i yid rab tu bde bar byas pa /
translated: It is formed of a great, pure river covered with fragrant lotus groves, which delights the minds of the people who have attained perfection.

original: ri bong can gyi dkyil 'khor ma lus pa gzugs brnyan shar ba dang 'dra bar mtsho chen pos phyogs gcig mngon par brgyan par byas pa /
analyzed: ri bong can gyi dkyil 'khor ma lus pa gzugs brnyan shar ba dang 'dra bar mtsho chen pos phyogs gcig mngon par brgyan par byas pa /
translated: It is adorned on one side by a great lake, in which the entire orb of the moon is reflected, as if it were a second moon.

original: lam gsum nas 'gro ba can gang g'a'i chu kun nas 'bab pas gro ga dang de ba da ru dang na me ru'i tshogs 'khrugs par byas pa dang chu bo de me rab tu 'dzag par byas pa dang / kha ba nye bar 'phel bas shin tu rags pa'i rtse mo stong nyid kyis /
analyzed: lam gsum nas 'gro ba can gang g'a'i chu kun nas 'bab pas gro ga dang de ba da ru dang na me ru'i tshogs 'khrugs par byas pa dang chu bo de me rab tu 'dzag par byas pa dang / kha ba nye bar 'phel bas shin tu rags pa'i rtse mo stong nyid kyis /
translated: The river Ganges, which flows from the three paths, falls down everywhere, agitating the flocks of ducks, geese and swans. The river causes the fire to burn intensely and the snow to increase, with its thousand peaks very high.

original: dngul gyi ka ba dang 'dra bar steng gyi phyogs kun nas khyab pa dang gnya' ral can las kun nas skrag pa'i g-yag gi tshogs rab tu zhugs pa spro bzhin pa'i rnga ma'i tshogs kyis g-yob bzhin pa'i ri sul dbu ma dang / ril 'bab pa'i chus brag rnams kyi mthil bkrus bzhin pa dang /
analyzed: dngul gyi ka ba dang 'dra bar steng gyi phyogs kun nas khyab pa dang gnya' ral can las kun nas skrag pa'i g-yag gi tshogs rab tu zhugs pa spro bzhin pa'i rnga ma'i tshogs kyis g-yob bzhin pa'i ri sul dbu ma dang / ril 'bab pa'i chus brag rnams kyi mthil bkrus bzhin pa dang /
translated: The middle valley, with its silver pillars, is covered all around above, and is filled with herds of yaks, who are frightened by the wild yak bulls, and are fanned by the moving tails of the yaks.🔽The middle of the mountain is washed by the flowing water,

original: me tog skyes pa'i lcug ma rnams kyis mthar 'khor bzhin pa dang / skad 'don pa'i bung ba'i tshogs kyis kun @51b nas glu blangs pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang bcas pa ltar rnam par mdzes par gyur pa'i sa 'dzin rnams kyi mchog la kha ba can gyi ri la /
analyzed: me tog skyes pa'i lcug ma rnams kyis mthar 'khor bzhin pa dang / skad 'don pa'i bung ba'i tshogs kyis kun @51b nas glu blangs pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang bcas pa ltar rnam par mdzes par gyur pa'i sa 'dzin rnams kyi mchog la kha ba can gyi ri la /
translated: and is surrounded by the ends of the vines with the growing flowers, and is all around sung to by the humming bees, and is beautiful as if it were being consecrated.🔽On that supreme mountain, the snowy mountain,

original: aindra n'i la dag pa ltar dri ma med pa dang dbugs dbyung ba'i rnam pa can gyi mgo bo 'dzin pa dang / chags pa ltar dkar ba'i mig gi phyogs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: aindra n'i la dag pa ltar dri ma med pa dang dbugs dbyung ba'i rnam pa can gyi mgo bo 'dzin pa dang / chags pa ltar dkar ba'i mig gi phyogs dang ldan pa /
translated: the best of mountains, which is pure like sapphire, and which has the form of a turban, and which has eyes that are white like attachment,

original: ni ma'i shing gi me tog gsal ba ltar dmar ba'i mchu can /
analyzed: ni ma'i shing gi me tog gsal ba ltar dmar ba'i mchu can /
translated: The lord of the peacocks, the bodhisattva called Golden Radiance, appeared, with a beak red like the clear flower of the coral tree,

original: rgya che ba dang sna tshogs pa'i sgro'i tshogs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rgya che ba dang sna tshogs pa'i sgro'i tshogs dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with a flock of large and varied feathers,

original: autpa la sngon po'i 'dab mas khyab pa'i gzhon nu ma'i shir sha'i me tog gi tshogs dang rjes su mthun pa'i che ba'i mjug sgro'i tshogs gser snang zhes bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rma bya'i bdag po byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: autpa la sngon po'i 'dab mas khyab pa'i gzhon nu ma'i shir sha'i me tog gi tshogs dang rjes su mthun pa'i che ba'i mjug sgro'i tshogs gser snang zhes bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rma bya'i bdag po byung bar gyur te /
translated: with a flock of large tail feathers that resembled a collection of young shirisha flowers covered with blue lotus petals.

original: rma bya'i mchog ni skyes byas nas //
analyzed: rma bya'i mchog ni skyes byas nas //
translated: Having been born as the best of peacocks,

original: de ni rnam pa sna tshogs su //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa sna tshogs su //
translated: he was seen in various ways

original: ngo mtshar ba ltar mthong byed cing //
analyzed: ngo mtshar ba ltar mthong byed cing //
translated: as if he were a wonder,

original: las kyi bzo ba rnams byung gyur //
analyzed: las kyi bzo ba rnams byung gyur //
translated: and the artisans of his actions appeared.

original: sprin rtsom dus la gar gyi rjes chags skyes pa ni //
analyzed: sprin rtsom dus la gar gyi rjes chags skyes pa ni //
translated: When the time of the composition of the clouds had come,

original: rma bya lhag pa'i rgyal po de ni mthong byed pa //
analyzed: rma bya lhag pa'i rgyal po de ni mthong byed pa //
translated: the king of the excellent peacocks was seen,

original: gsal ba chung ba ngo tsha ldan pa ltar dman pa'i //
analyzed: gsal ba chung ba ngo tsha ldan pa ltar dman pa'i //
translated: as if he were a modest and bashful young man,

original: glog dang 'brel ba can rnams kyi ni sgeg pa byung //
analyzed: glog dang 'brel ba can rnams kyi ni sgeg pa byung //
translated: with the grace of those connected with lightning.

original: ri yi chu ni rdza rnga bzhin du sgra ldan pa //
analyzed: ri yi chu ni rdza rnga bzhin du sgra ldan pa //
translated: The mountain streams have voices like clay drums.

original: bung ba'i pi wang rnams ni 'jam pa'i skad ldan pa //
analyzed: bung ba'i pi wang rnams ni 'jam pa'i skad ldan pa //
translated: The bees' flutes have a soft sound.

original: lcug ma'i nags kyi khyim du yid 'phrog pa //
analyzed: lcug ma'i nags kyi khyim du yid 'phrog pa //
translated: In the house of the forest of vines, the mind is captivated.

original: rma bya sgeg po de ni sna tshogs gar byed gyur //
analyzed: rma bya sgeg po de ni sna tshogs gar byed gyur //
translated: The peacock, the handsome one, performs various dances.

original: kun nas 'phro ba'i mdongs kyi rin chen tshogs ldan pa //
analyzed: kun nas 'phro ba'i mdongs kyi rin chen tshogs ldan pa //
translated: Possessing a collection of jewels of eyes that radiate in all directions,

original: gang tshe 'gram gyi mtha' la 'dzegs nas des gar byas //
analyzed: gang tshe 'gram gyi mtha' la 'dzegs nas des gar byas //
translated: when he climbs to the edge of the pond and dances,

original: rlung gis kun nas 'dar ba'i nags can kha ba'i ri //
analyzed: rlung gis kun nas 'dar ba'i nags can kha ba'i ri //
translated: the mountain of snow, the forest shaken by the wind,

original: de tshe cod pan ldan pa ltar ni rnam snang gyur //
analyzed: de tshe cod pan ldan pa ltar ni rnam snang gyur //
translated: at that time appears as if having a crown.

original: yid 'ong sgra sgrogs rnam par rgyas byed 'dod pa'i bud med kyis //
analyzed: yid 'ong sgra sgrogs rnam par rgyas byed 'dod pa'i bud med kyis //
translated: The women of desire, the expanders, who make beautiful sounds,

original: sa yi ri mo la ni khyad par 'dra bar bris pa la //
analyzed: sa yi ri mo la ni khyad par 'dra bar bris pa la //
translated: on the lines of the earth, which are drawn with a special likeness,

original: rma bya der ni gnas pa grub pa'i bud med rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: rma bya der ni gnas pa grub pa'i bud med rnams kyis ni //
translated: the peacocks, who dwell there, the women of accomplishment,

original: lta ba shin tu ngo mtshar dbang gis tshim par ma gyur te //
analyzed: lta ba shin tu ngo mtshar dbang gis tshim par ma gyur te //
translated: are not satisfied by the power of their extremely wondrous gaze.

original: kun nas dge ba'i sprin gyi tshogs kyis 'khrigs pa'i phyogs sgo'i mtha' //
analyzed: kun nas dge ba'i sprin gyi tshogs kyis 'khrigs pa'i phyogs sgo'i mtha' //
translated: The directions, the ends of the horizon, were enveloped in a cloud of auspiciousness.

original: dri ma med pa'i chu ni gdong ba'i ston ka'i dus byung la //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i chu ni gdong ba'i ston ka'i dus byung la //
translated: The pure water was like the face of autumn.

original: gang la sgro tshogs ldan des mdongs kyi rin chen tshogs dor ba //
analyzed: gang la sgro tshogs ldan des mdongs kyi rin chen tshogs dor ba //
translated: Where the flock of peacocks, with their precious plumage, cast off their feathers,

original: sa de aindra n'i la'i dum bu ltar ni mdzes par gyur //
analyzed: sa de aindra n'i la'i dum bu ltar ni mdzes par gyur //
translated: that place became beautiful, like a piece of sapphire.

original: yid 'ong rim gyis rnam par dpyod pa'i rma bya'i sgro mdongs ni //
analyzed: yid 'ong rim gyis rnam par dpyod pa'i rma bya'i sgro mdongs ni //
translated: The peacock feathers, which were gradually examined with delight,

original: tshogs dang rjes su song ba'i 'gro ba'i dge ba phyogs gcig pa //🔽de yod pa la 'dzin mchog rma bya'i rgyal po ni //
analyzed: tshogs dang rjes su song ba'i 'gro ba'i dge ba phyogs gcig pa // de yod pa la 'dzin mchog rma bya'i rgyal po ni //
translated: were the virtue of the people who had come together and followed.

original: dbang @52a * //
analyzed: dbang @52a * //
translated: The king of the peacocks, the supreme holder of that which exists,

original: po'i gzhu rnams kyis ni 'dres pa lta bur sa mdzes gyur //
analyzed: po'i gzhu rnams kyis ni 'dres pa lta bur sa mdzes gyur //
translated: the earth was beautiful, as if mixed with the bows of Indra.

original: de nas dus gcig gi tshe rlung gi stobs kyis rnam par 'byed par gyur pa'i me tog rnams kyi dris dri zhim par byas pa'i phyogs kyi sgo rnams yod pa dang / 'khor bzhin ba'i bung ba'i tshogs kyis 'dres pa dang // glang po che'i phru gu'i so ltar kun nas skya ba dang /
analyzed: de nas dus gcig gi tshe rlung gi stobs kyis rnam par 'byed par gyur pa'i me tog rnams kyi dris dri zhim par byas pa'i phyogs kyi sgo rnams yod pa dang / 'khor bzhin ba'i bung ba'i tshogs kyis 'dres pa dang // glang po che'i phru gu'i so ltar kun nas skya ba dang /
translated: Then, at one time, the wind's power separates the flowers, and the directions become fragrant with their scent,🔽mixed with the swarms of bees that circle around, and with the ketaka flowers that are completely white like the tusks of young elephants.🔽The middle valley is made fragrant with the flowers of the kṛtamālā,

original: rol pa dang bcas pa'i snying po can gyi ke ta yod pa dang / rtseg mar skyes dang phyogs skyes dang / ni pa dang / ka tam pa'i me tog gis ri sul dbu ma dri zhim par byas pa dang / dbang po'i sbas pas mngon par brgyan par byas pa'i ma ra ka dang /
analyzed: rol pa dang bcas pa'i snying po can gyi ke ta yod pa dang / rtseg mar skyes dang phyogs skyes dang / ni pa dang / ka tam pa'i me tog gis ri sul dbu ma dri zhim par byas pa dang / dbang po'i sbas pas mngon par brgyan par byas pa'i ma ra ka dang /
translated: the directional flowers, the nipas, and the katakas, and is adorned with the mārakas that are hidden by the senses.

original: rtsva sar pa sngon pos nags kyis rnams ljang gu yod pa dang / mig dga' bar gyur pa'i sa 'dzin pa yod pa dang / spros pa byed pa'i glog gi 'khyug pas lto ba mtshan par byas pa dang / dbang po'i gzhu bstan pa dang /
analyzed: rtsva sar pa sngon pos nags kyis rnams ljang gu yod pa dang / mig dga' bar gyur pa'i sa 'dzin pa yod pa dang / spros pa byed pa'i glog gi 'khyug pas lto ba mtshan par byas pa dang / dbang po'i gzhu bstan pa dang /
