analyzed: de yi tshe na 'di yi bud med yang dag 'brel ba'i bde ba 'dod pa skye ba ste //
translated: then there arises in him a desire for the pleasure of real union with a woman.

original: grol ba'i don gnyer dbang po'i tshogs ni rgyal bas 'di yang rnam par rgyal ba ste //
analyzed: grol ba'i don gnyer dbang po'i tshogs ni rgyal bas 'di yang rnam par rgyal ba ste //
translated: The Conqueror has declared this to be a victory for the host of senses seeking liberation.

original: 'di la lha yi mdzes ma dang ni sa yi rang bzhin bud med 'di la mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di la lha yi mdzes ma dang ni sa yi rang bzhin bud med 'di la mnyam par 'gyur //
translated: “In this case, the heavenly beauty and the earthly woman are equal.

original: gal te rigs pa dang bcas mdzes pa'i skye bo lam ni dmigs phyir 'dod na ni //
analyzed: gal te rigs pa dang bcas mdzes pa'i skye bo lam ni dmigs phyir 'dod na ni //
translated: If you desire a beautiful man because you see the path of reason,

original: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pa'i ngag ni 'da' bar mi 'gyur de ltar khyod kyis shig / rnam par smin pa rtsa ba yid kyi yul gyi bde ba'i chas ni ci zhig ste //
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar gshegs pa'i ngag ni 'da' bar mi 'gyur de ltar khyod kyis shig / rnam par smin pa rtsa ba yid kyi yul gyi bde ba'i chas ni ci zhig ste //
translated: What is the use of the pleasure of the objects of the mind, which is the root of the ripening of karma?

original: mi dge ba yi bud shing chen po dmyal ba'i me ni kun nas mthong byed cing //
analyzed: mi dge ba yi bud shing chen po dmyal ba'i me ni kun nas mthong byed cing //
translated: The great fuel of nonvirtue is seen to be the fire of hell.

original: de ltar bsgom pa yang ni gal te nyin re rer //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa yang ni gal te nyin re rer //
translated: If you meditate in this way, even if it is only for a day,

original: mi sdug pa ni yang dag sdug pa rnyed mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni yang dag sdug pa rnyed mi 'gyur //
translated: you will not find that the repulsive is attractive.

original: des na rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ni phyi nas kyang //
analyzed: des na rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ni phyi nas kyang //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of complete peace,

original: bud med pa yi gnas su lhag par gnas par bya //
analyzed: bud med pa yi gnas su lhag par gnas par bya //
translated: you should remain in the abode of celibacy.”

original: de nas dka' thub pa'i bu de gus pa dang bcas pas byang chub sems dpa'i tshig mngon par brten par byas nas dgon pa gzhan du song ste //
analyzed: de nas dka' thub pa'i bu de gus pa dang bcas pas byang chub sems dpa'i tshig mngon par brten par byas nas dgon pa gzhan du song ste //
translated: Then the son of the ascetic, with respect, accepted the words of the Bodhisattva and went to another forest.

original: der yang bsam gtan bzhi dang mngon par shes pa lnga rnams la gnas nas slar 'ongs te //
analyzed: der yang bsam gtan bzhi dang mngon par shes pa lnga rnams la gnas nas slar 'ongs te //
translated: There, he remained in the four dhyānas and five superknowledges, and then returned.

original: gsal bar byas ba'i byang chub thob pa la mngon par dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la /🔽gnyis las 'das ba zhi ba ma zhi'i sems rnams la //🔽rab zhi'i don du zhi ba'i lam ni gsal byed pa //
analyzed: gsal bar byas ba'i byang chub thob pa la mngon par dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la / gnyis las 'das ba zhi ba ma zhi'i sems rnams la // rab zhi'i don du zhi ba'i lam ni gsal byed pa //
translated: To the Bodhisattvas who delight in the attainment of enlightenment,🔽which is made clear by the two,🔽the path of peace is made clear for the sake of the complete pacification of the minds of those who have transcended the two,

original: rab tu dang ba'i skud pas bcings pa dri zhim po'i //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba'i skud pas bcings pa dri zhim po'i //
translated: those who are peaceful and those who are not peaceful.

original: ngag gi me tog rnams kyis yang yang de la mchod //
analyzed: ngag gi me tog rnams kyis yang yang de la mchod //
translated: Again and again, I worship him with the fragrant flowers of speech,🔽which are bound with the thread of clear faith.

original: @64b gal te khyod ni yang dag skye 'gyur ma yin na //
analyzed: @64b gal te khyod ni yang dag skye 'gyur ma yin na //
translated: If you are not truly born,

original: bdag gi mun pa 'di ni 'di ltar zad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag gi mun pa 'di ni 'di ltar zad mi 'gyur //
translated: then my darkness will not be destroyed in this way.

original: ri bong can ni dag pa'i 'od zer shar ba la //
analyzed: ri bong can ni dag pa'i 'od zer shar ba la //
translated: When the pure light of the moon rises,

original: ku mu ta ni ji ltar phye bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: ku mu ta ni ji ltar phye bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: how can the kumuta flower not open?

original: bla na med pa'i go 'phang mngon par 'dod pa ni //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i go 'phang mngon par 'dod pa ni //
translated: Those who aspire to the unsurpassed state

original: 'gro bar phan min zad phyir brtson pa'i bdag nyid can//
analyzed: 'gro bar phan min zad phyir brtson pa'i bdag nyid can//
translated: are not diligent for the sake of their own exhaustion, but for the benefit of the world.

original: brtan pa lci ba'i yid can blo gros che rnams kyi //
analyzed: brtan pa lci ba'i yid can blo gros che rnams kyi //
translated: Those who are steadfast, with heavy minds and great intelligence,

original: khyed cag lta bu'i 'byung ba rnyed sla min pa nyid //
analyzed: khyed cag lta bu'i 'byung ba rnyed sla min pa nyid //
translated: it is not easy for them to appear, as in your case.

original: de ltar spyod pa 'di ni rnam par dag ldan pa /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa 'di ni rnam par dag ldan pa /
translated: This conduct is endowed with purity.

original: gzhan la phan par byed pa'i rtse gcig gang khyod la //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par byed pa'i rtse gcig gang khyod la //
translated: You are one-pointed in benefiting others.

original: go 'phang de ni srid med byed pa tshul khrims brten //
analyzed: go 'phang de ni srid med byed pa tshul khrims brten //
translated: You are firm in discipline, which brings about the non-existence of existence.

original: thob par ma byas par ni ji ltar brtan par byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: thob par ma byas par ni ji ltar brtan par byed par 'gyur //
translated: How can you be firm without attaining that state?

original: gang tshe skyon rnams zad pa khyod ni byang chub thob 'gyur na //
analyzed: gang tshe skyon rnams zad pa khyod ni byang chub thob 'gyur na //
translated: When you attain enlightenment, with all faults exhausted,

original: gti mug rab rib rtsad nas bton pa'i 'gro ba la phan phyir //
analyzed: gti mug rab rib rtsad nas bton pa'i 'gro ba la phan phyir //
translated: For the sake of benefiting beings, who have completely removed the darkness of delusion,

original: de tshe khyod ni srid med bdag la dran byed 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: de tshe khyod ni srid med bdag la dran byed 'gyur ba ste //
translated: At that time, you will be a reminder to me, who is non-existent.

original: bsod nams las de de ltar shes bya 'di la khas blangs 'gyur //
analyzed: bsod nams las de de ltar shes bya 'di la khas blangs 'gyur //
translated: This should be understood as the merit of that action.

original: dka' thub pa'i bu de yang byang chub thob pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu yid la re ba thob par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dka' thub pa'i bu de yang byang chub thob pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu yid la re ba thob par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: And that son of the ascetic, having attained enlightenment, the Blessed One caused him to attain the fruit of arhatship, which was his wish.

original: de ltar na bdag nyid kyi tshul khrims rnam par dag pas kyang de ltar dam pa rnams kun nas dga' par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid kyi tshul khrims rnam par dag pas kyang de ltar dam pa rnams kun nas dga' par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the pure morality of the self does not bring about such delight in the holy ones.

original: ji ltar gzhan log pa'i lam la yid zhugs pa dag pa'i tshul khrims la so sor gnas par byas nas kun nas dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan log pa'i lam la yid zhugs pa dag pa'i tshul khrims la so sor gnas par byas nas kun nas dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But when one has caused others, who have entered the wrong path, to abide in morality, then there is delight.

original: de bas na tshul khrims kyi bya ba la 'bad par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims kyi bya ba la 'bad par bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, one should strive in the practice of morality.🔽This is the Jataka of the Seer.

original: drang srong gi skyes pa'i rabs te skyes pa'i rabs gsum pa'o /
analyzed: drang srong gi skyes pa'i rabs te skyes pa'i rabs gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third chapter.

original: // / pha ma zhes bya dge ba'i lo tog bskyed//
analyzed: // / pha ma zhes bya dge ba'i lo tog bskyed//
translated: The field of the virtuous harvest is called “mother and father.”

original: pan  gdags bya ba'i zhing ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: pan  gdags bya ba'i zhing ni 'di yin te //
translated: This is the field to be tilled.

original: gang la 'di yi blo gros 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: gang la 'di yi blo gros 'byung ba ni //
translated: The mind that arises from it

original: de nyid de dag la ni rten par byed //
analyzed: de nyid de dag la ni rten par byed //
translated: is the very thing that supports them.

original: 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
translated: Thus it was heard:

original: ma lus pa'i sa'i phun sum tshogs pa gcig tu gnas pa dang 'dra ba'i b'a r'a na s'ir tshul gyi rab tu tsha bas grags pa'i rnam par gnon pa skye dgu la phan pa dang mi phan pa yang dag par lta ba'i rgyal po tshangs pas byin zhes🔽bya ba byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i sa'i phun sum tshogs pa gcig tu gnas pa dang 'dra ba'i b'a r'a na s'ir tshul gyi rab tu tsha bas grags pa'i rnam par gnon pa skye dgu la phan pa dang mi phan pa yang dag par lta ba'i rgyal po tshangs pas byin zhes bya ba byung bar gyur to //
translated: In Vārāṇasī, which is like a single abode of all the perfections of the earth, there was a king named Brahmadatta, who was renowned for his intense discipline, who benefited living beings, who was a king of the right view.

original: de yang dran pa dang rig byed kyi de kho na shes pa rang gis chos rjes su bsgrub pas grags pa gsal ba //
analyzed: de yang dran pa dang rig byed kyi de kho na shes pa rang gis chos rjes su bsgrub pas grags pa gsal ba //
translated: He was known for his practice of Dharma through his own knowledge of the truth of mindfulness and the Vedas.

original: bstan bcos thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pa //
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pa //
translated: He had reached the other shore of all the treatises.

original: 'chi med bdag po lha'i bla ma dang @65a * //
analyzed: 'chi med bdag po lha'i bla ma dang @65a * //
translated: He was like the lord of the deathless, the divine teacher,

original: 'dra ba / gus pa ltar ni tshangs pa yis //
analyzed: 'dra ba / gus pa ltar ni tshangs pa yis //
translated: and like Brahmā, he was revered.

original: zhi ba'i dpal gyis 'khyud pa ni //
analyzed: zhi ba'i dpal gyis 'khyud pa ni //
translated: He was embraced by the glory of peace,

original: yongs su smin dang thos pa yis //🔽mdun na 'don ni mchog 'byung gyur //
analyzed: yongs su smin dang thos pa yis // mdun na 'don ni mchog 'byung gyur //
translated: and through his full maturation and learning,🔽he had an excellent priest.

original: shin tu myur bar 'di khrid pa //
analyzed: shin tu myur bar 'di khrid pa //
translated: He was led by him with great speed,

original: 'chi bdag nye mor 'di yis ni //
analyzed: 'chi bdag nye mor 'di yis ni //
translated: and by this, the lord of death🔽became very close.

original: de ltar khros pa ltar rgas pa //
analyzed: de ltar khros pa ltar rgas pa //
translated: Thus, as if angry, old age

original: de yi tshangs pa'i dpal gyis mthong //🔽bu ni don gnyer can de yi //
analyzed: de yi tshangs pa'i dpal gyis mthong // bu ni don gnyer can de yi //
translated: His glory was that of Brahma.🔽The Bodhisattva, who was the son

original: bur ni byang chub sems dpa' byung //
analyzed: bur ni byang chub sems dpa' byung //
translated: of that man who was in need of a son,

original: ming gis sngo bsangs zhes byar grags //
analyzed: ming gis sngo bsangs zhes byar grags //
translated: was known by the name of Shvetaketu.

original: tshul khrims brtan pos rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: tshul khrims brtan pos rnam par brgyan //
translated: He was adorned with firm morality.

original: bskyod pa'i dbang po'i rlabs rnams kyis //
analyzed: bskyod pa'i dbang po'i rlabs rnams kyis //
translated: The waves of the agitated senses

original: gsal ba 'khrug pa mi bskyod pa //
analyzed: gsal ba 'khrug pa mi bskyod pa //
translated: do not disturb the clear

original: blo yi gru la de zhugs nas //
analyzed: blo yi gru la de zhugs nas //
translated: one who has entered the boat of the mind

original: rig pa'i rgya mtsho phar phyin gyur //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgya mtsho phar phyin gyur //
translated: and crossed the ocean of knowledge.

original: zla ba ltar mdzes de yi ni //
analyzed: zla ba ltar mdzes de yi ni //
translated: He was as beautiful as the moon,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni snyan smra ba //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni snyan smra ba //
translated: and his nature was to speak pleasantly.

original: grogs phyogs thams cad du byung ste //
analyzed: grogs phyogs thams cad du byung ste //
translated: He was a friend to all,

original: dbus gnas dgra dag yod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dbus gnas dgra dag yod mi 'gyur //
translated: and there was no enemy in the middle.

original: brtan zhing dul ba'i chos ldan pa //
analyzed: brtan zhing dul ba'i chos ldan pa //
translated: He was steadfast and disciplined,

original: yon tan smra ba thams cad la //🔽sdang byed sdang ba nyid kyis kyang //
analyzed: yon tan smra ba thams cad la // sdang byed sdang ba nyid kyis kyang //
translated: and all who spoke of his good qualities🔽saw that he should be abandoned

original: dor bya de nyid mthong ba yin //
analyzed: dor bya de nyid mthong ba yin //
translated: because of his hostility towards the hostile.

original: de nas de'i bdag nyid chen po rgas pa dang yongs su 'dres pas yan lag stobs chung ba'i pha ma dag la shin tu stobs dang ldan pa'i rab rib kyis khyab pa'i mthong ba'i nus pa mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de'i bdag nyid chen po rgas pa dang yongs su 'dres pas yan lag stobs chung ba'i pha ma dag la shin tu stobs dang ldan pa'i rab rib kyis khyab pa'i mthong ba'i nus pa mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: Then, as the great man grew old and was mixed with old age, the power of his limbs weakened, and the power of his eyesight, which was very strong, disappeared, being pervaded by cataracts.

analyzed: de nas mdun na 'don de rgyal po'i mdun du nye bar 'ongs te smras pa / lha lags lta ba rnams bral bud med lhan cig tu //
translated: Then, the chief minister came into the presence of the king and said:🔽Your Majesty, I am striving to go with my wife

original: dka' thub nags su 'gro phyir bdag brtson pa //
analyzed: dka' thub nags su 'gro phyir bdag brtson pa //
translated: to the forest of asceticism.

original: de bas bdag gi yon tan rin chen rgya mtsho can //🔽bu ni mdun na 'don pa nyid du dbang bskur mdzod //
analyzed: de bas bdag gi yon tan rin chen rgya mtsho can // bu ni mdun na 'don pa nyid du dbang bskur mdzod //
translated: Therefore, in my precious ocean of qualities,🔽anoint my son as the chief minister himself.

original: bag med rgyu can dang po'i yang ni lang tshol //
analyzed: bag med rgyu can dang po'i yang ni lang tshol //
translated: Youth, which is the cause of heedlessness, is at first

original: blo ldan la ni khyim gyi gnas ni mi rigs te //🔽rgas pa'i dgra ni dbang po'i dbang ba gcod pa ni //
analyzed: blo ldan la ni khyim gyi gnas ni mi rigs te // rgas pa'i dgra ni dbang po'i dbang ba gcod pa ni //
translated: unsuitable for the wise to remain in the household.🔽What need is there to mention the destruction of memory and the harm to the mind

original: dran pa nyams pa sems gnod par ni smos ci dgos //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa sems gnod par ni smos ci dgos //
translated: when the enemy of old age severs the control of the senses?

original: lhas ni bdag dka' thub bsgrub pa la bar du gcod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: lhas ni bdag dka' thub bsgrub pa la bar du gcod par mi bya ste /
translated: The gods will not obstruct my practice of austerities.🔽May the gods look upon me!

analyzed: lhas gzigs par mdzod cig / gang tshe dri ma can gyi las ni 'dod 'gyur na //
translated: When you desire to do a defiled action,

analyzed: de tshe skye ba grogs pos dgag par bya ba ste //

original: gang tshe chos dang 'brel ba'i bya ba dmigs byed na //
analyzed: gang tshe chos dang 'brel ba'i bya ba dmigs byed na //
translated: When you undertake an action connected with the Dharma,

original: de tshe phan par 'dod pas de ni rab bskul bya //
analyzed: de tshe phan par 'dod pas de ni rab bskul bya //
translated: then you should be strongly encouraged by those who desire your welfare.

original: de nas rgyal po de pha dang 'dra bar mdun na 'don dka' thub kyi nags der 'gro bar 'dod pa la sdug bsngal gyis yang dag @65b par byung ba mchi ma'i chus kun nas gdungs pa'i mig can gyis sngo bsangs la bos nas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de pha dang 'dra bar mdun na 'don dka' thub kyi nags der 'gro bar 'dod pa la sdug bsngal gyis yang dag @65b par byung ba mchi ma'i chus kun nas gdungs pa'i mig can gyis sngo bsangs la bos nas smras pa /
translated: Then the king, like a father, desiring to go to the forest of austerities of the chief minister, with eyes filled with tears of sorrow, called to Śyāma and said:

original: 'di ni khyod kyi bla ma'i skye bo'i dka' thub kyi nags su 'gro bar 'dod pa yin te //
analyzed: 'di ni khyod kyi bla ma'i skye bo'i dka' thub kyi nags su 'gro bar 'dod pa yin te //
translated: “This is your guru, the chief minister, who desires to go to the forest of austerities.

original: des na khyod kyis bdag cag las mdun na 'don 'di nyid blang bar gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na khyod kyis bdag cag las mdun na 'don 'di nyid blang bar gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, you should take this chief minister from me.”

original: de nas sngo bsangs skad cig tsam du 'og tu lta bas gnas nas bdag nyid la song ba'i 'di ltar sems la rjes su bstan par byed par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas sngo bsangs skad cig tsam du 'og tu lta bas gnas nas bdag nyid la song ba'i 'di ltar sems la rjes su bstan par byed par gyur to //
translated: Then, looking down for an instant, he saw the dark-blue water, and he taught his mind this lesson:

original: sems kyi glang po'i dbang po bde ba'i cha la chags pa 'di //
analyzed: sems kyi glang po'i dbang po bde ba'i cha la chags pa 'di //
translated: “This elephant of the mind, attached to the pleasures of the senses,

original: sred pa'i glang mo sdug bsngal rgyu yi ci phyir rjes su 'gro //🔽chog shes ri dang bral bas dam min rnams kyi drung du ni //
analyzed: sred pa'i glang mo sdug bsngal rgyu yi ci phyir rjes su 'gro // chog shes ri dang bral bas dam min rnams kyi drung du ni //
translated: why does it follow after the she-elephant of craving, the cause of suffering?

original: nges par na tsha 'di ni khyod la sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: nges par na tsha 'di ni khyod la sdug bsngal byed par 'gyur //
translated: “When it is separated from the mountain of contentment, it will certainly be tormented by suffering in the presence of the wicked.

original: rnam par rol bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan padma rnams kyis khyab //🔽mkhas pa rnams kyi gtam gyis padmo zhi ba gzung byas nas //
analyzed: rnam par rol bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan padma rnams kyis khyab // mkhas pa rnams kyi gtam gyis padmo zhi ba gzung byas nas //
translated: “The lotus grove of good qualities, which is the object of enjoyment,

original: rgal bar dka' ba'i skyon gyis 'dam can brten pa'i chu bo ni //
analyzed: rgal bar dka' ba'i skyon gyis 'dam can brten pa'i chu bo ni //
translated: having been seized by the water-beast of heedlessness,🔽why do you not desire to cross over the river of existence, which is full of mud and difficult to cross,

original: gting med 'jigs pa 'dzin pa'i don du ci phyir zhes ni 'dod //
analyzed: gting med 'jigs pa 'dzin pa'i don du ci phyir zhes ni 'dod //
translated: in order to save yourself from the fear of the fathomless abyss?

original: gal te stobs dang ldan pa khyod kyis kun nas skyong ba 'di //
analyzed: gal te stobs dang ldan pa khyod kyis kun nas skyong ba 'di //
translated: “If you, who are powerful, were to protect this mind

original: lam ngan 'gro ba skyong ba glang po che yi tshogs //🔽skyon gyi lcag kyu'i rma ni rnam 'byed ces bya 'phags min pa'i //
analyzed: lam ngan 'gro ba skyong ba glang po che yi tshogs // skyon gyi lcag kyu'i rma ni rnam 'byed ces bya 'phags min pa'i //
translated: The herd of elephants, the bad paths, the bad migrations.

original: yul gyi glang po skyong ba rnams kyis nam yang gnod mi 'gyur//
analyzed: yul gyi glang po skyong ba rnams kyis nam yang gnod mi 'gyur//
translated: The wound of the goad of faults, the division called, is never harmed by the keepers of the elephants of the objects of the non-noble ones.

original: 'khor ba'i lam nas 'gro ba'i ngal ba 'joms par byed pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i lam nas 'gro ba'i ngal ba 'joms par byed pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of overcoming the fatigue of going on the path of cyclic existence,

original: dam pa rnams kyi man ngag chu ni shin tu dang ba la //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyi man ngag chu ni shin tu dang ba la //
translated: The very clear water of the instructions of the holy ones,

original: khrus byas nas ni rnam rmongs bya ba ngan la chags pa'i rdul //
analyzed: khrus byas nas ni rnam rmongs bya ba ngan la chags pa'i rdul //
translated: Having bathed in, the dust of attachment to bad actions out of delusion,

original: bdag la phan 'dod rnams kyis spangs pa bdag la ci zhig gtor //
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dod rnams kyis spangs pa bdag la ci zhig gtor //
translated: What is cast upon me by those who desire their own benefit?

original: sems kyi glang po mang pos smras pas ci zhig bya ste 'khor ba rnam par gcad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems kyi glang po mang pos smras pas ci zhig bya ste 'khor ba rnam par gcad pa'i phyir //
translated: What is the use of the many words of the elephant of the mind? For the sake of cutting off cyclic existence,

original: gal te dka' thub gnas kyi bde ba mkhas pa rnams kyis yun ring longs spyod 'dod na ni //
analyzed: gal te dka' thub gnas kyi bde ba mkhas pa rnams kyis yun ring longs spyod 'dod na ni //
translated: If the wise ones desire to enjoy for a long time the happiness of the place of austerities,

original: skye bo'i nges par 'brel pa stobs dang ldan pa re ba'i rang bzhin lcags sgrog bcad nas kyang //
analyzed: skye bo'i nges par 'brel pa stobs dang ldan pa re ba'i rang bzhin lcags sgrog bcad nas kyang //
translated: Having cut the iron fetters of the powerful nature of hope, the certain connection of people,

original: de bas longs spyod chags pa'i rang bzhin brtan pa gcod pa dka' ba rtsad nas 'don par gyis //
analyzed: de bas longs spyod chags pa'i rang bzhin brtan pa gcod pa dka' ba rtsad nas 'don par gyis //
translated: Therefore, you should uproot the nature of attachment to wealth, which is difficult to cut off.

original: de ltar sems la rjes su brtan par byas te rgyal po la smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar sems la rjes su brtan par byas te rgyal po la smras pa /
translated: Having thus reflected on his mind, he said to the king:

original: rgyal po chen po khyim la gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di rtsod pa dang 'thab pa dang / spyod ba rnams kyi rten nyes par spyod pa'i lto 'phye du ma rnams kyi khyim dang rang gi skye bo rnams la @66a * //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po khyim la gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di rtsod pa dang 'thab pa dang / spyod ba rnams kyi rten nyes par spyod pa'i lto 'phye du ma rnams kyi khyim dang rang gi skye bo rnams la @66a * //
translated: “Great King, this so-called ‘living at home’ is the basis for disputes, quarrels, and bad conduct. It is the home of many evil-­doing demons and the source of family life.

original: mnyes gshin pa bcings pas dka' thub kyi nags su 'gro ba la bar du gcod pa dang / log pa'i tshig rnams kyi 'byung gnas dang // brten pa dang phongs pa skye bar byed pa dang / legs pa'i lam gyi mnyen pa dang / rgya mtsho bzhin du chu'i tshogs chen po rnams kyis kyang yo byad rnams kyis kun nas 'gengs bzhin pa rnams kyis tshim pa nye bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mnyes gshin pa bcings pas dka' thub kyi nags su 'gro ba la bar du gcod pa dang / log pa'i tshig rnams kyi 'byung gnas dang // brten pa dang phongs pa skye bar byed pa dang / legs pa'i lam gyi mnyen pa dang / rgya mtsho bzhin du chu'i tshogs chen po rnams kyis kyang yo byad rnams kyis kun nas 'gengs bzhin pa rnams kyis tshim pa nye bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The mind is bound by attachment to friends, and this obstructs going to the forest for ascetic practice.🔽The mind is the source of all wrong words, the support and origin of poverty, the obstacle to the path of the good, and the ocean that fills with the great flood of all desires.

original: yul gyi zhags pa rnams kyis sems chung ba rnams kyi snying kun nas 'ching bar byed pa dang / skal ba kun nas zad pa'i phyir phun sum tshogs pa zad pa dang // tha mar yang dri ma can gyi gos rul bgos pa'i khyim gyi bdag po bkres pas rid pa dang /
analyzed: yul gyi zhags pa rnams kyis sems chung ba rnams kyi snying kun nas 'ching bar byed pa dang / skal ba kun nas zad pa'i phyir phun sum tshogs pa zad pa dang // tha mar yang dri ma can gyi gos rul bgos pa'i khyim gyi bdag po bkres pas rid pa dang /
translated: The mind is the noose of objects that completely binds the hearts of the weak, the end of all good fortune because it exhausts all good fortune, and the end of the house of the body, which is like a house of filth.

original: byis pa du ba rnams kyis ma mo'i skye bo ltas bzhin pa dang / bang mdzod 'bras kyi so bas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor gyi skye bo sdug bsngal ba dang / don du gnyer ba rnams kyis sgo mnan pa sems dang bcas pa su zhig gi snying yid mi bde ba mi bskyed dam //
analyzed: byis pa du ba rnams kyis ma mo'i skye bo ltas bzhin pa dang / bang mdzod 'bras kyi so bas stong pa nyid kyis 'khor gyi skye bo sdug bsngal ba dang / don du gnyer ba rnams kyis sgo mnan pa sems dang bcas pa su zhig gi snying yid mi bde ba mi bskyed dam //
translated: Who would not be distressed at heart, a mother at the sight of her child in flames, a steward at the sight of an empty granary, a man in the sight of his starving family?

original: gal te yang gtan du ba'i bde ba'i rgyu nyid khyim na gnas pa nyid yin na de lta na yang dka' thub kyi nags mngon par phyogs pa long ba pha ma gnyis kun nas dor nas bdag la mdun na 'don pa gzung ba'i phyir rigs pa ni ma🔽yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gal te yang gtan du ba'i bde ba'i rgyu nyid khyim na gnas pa nyid yin na de lta na yang dka' thub kyi nags mngon par phyogs pa long ba pha ma gnyis kun nas dor nas bdag la mdun na 'don pa gzung ba'i phyir rigs pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But if it is the cause of permanent happiness to live at home, it is not right for me to go to the forest of asceticism, leaving behind my blind and helpless parents. I must take care of them.

original: mig dang bral ba'i pha dang ma ni 'di dag la //
analyzed: mig dang bral ba'i pha dang ma ni 'di dag la //
translated: My blind father and mother

original: bkres dang skom bas rab tu rid par byas pa ni //🔽nags na gnas pa dag la chu'am 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: bkres dang skom bas rab tu rid par byas pa ni // nags na gnas pa dag la chu'am 'bras bu ni //
translated: are emaciated by hunger and thirst.🔽Who will give them food and drink

original: bdag ni med par su zhig sbyin par 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag ni med par su zhig sbyin par 'gyur //
translated: when I am gone to the forest?

original: chu bo drung na nye ba 'di ni dang zhing dang ba'i chu ni 'bab pa ste //
analyzed: chu bo drung na nye ba 'di ni dang zhing dang ba'i chu ni 'bab pa ste //
translated: This stream, clear and pure, flows near at hand;

original: grib ma mthug pa lam nas 'gro ba'i skye bos brten bya lam du shing 'di ni //🔽kun nas dbugs par byed cing 'di ltar 'gro ba'i ngal bas nad dang bcas pa la //
analyzed: grib ma mthug pa lam nas 'gro ba'i skye bos brten bya lam du shing 'di ni // kun nas dbugs par byed cing 'di ltar 'gro ba'i ngal bas nad dang bcas pa la //
translated: this tree, with its thick shade, stands on the road, inviting the traveler to rest.🔽But I, who am tormented by the fever of love, what will I do with the stream, the shade, or the road?

original: bdag gi pha ma dag la snying rje bcas pa su zhig smra ba po byung 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag gi pha ma dag la snying rje bcas pa su zhig smra ba po byung 'gyur //
translated: Who, indeed, will be so cruel as to speak to my father and mother?🔽If, hoping for happiness, I remain at home, I shall be the slave of my elders;

original: mdun 'don nyid kyi bde la re bas gal te khyim na gnas shing dbang du bla ma dag / lam kun 'phos pas khron pa'am ri yi 'gram nas ltung ba su zhig las ni thos pas 'gyur //
analyzed: mdun 'don nyid kyi bde la re bas gal te khyim na gnas shing dbang du bla ma dag / lam kun 'phos pas khron pa'am ri yi 'gram nas ltung ba su zhig las ni thos pas 'gyur //
translated: if I go away, who will tell my parents, who are as dear to me as the stream and the tree?

original: lus kyi btson ra dang ni nges par 'brel ba srog 'di bdag ni ji ltar 'dzin 'gyur te //
analyzed: lus kyi btson ra dang ni nges par 'brel ba srog 'di bdag ni ji ltar 'dzin 'gyur te //
translated: How can I take with me my body, which is bound to this prison, my life, which is uncertain?

original: de phyir sa dbang mchog gis pha ma dag dang lhan cig 'gro ba bdag la dgag ma mdzad //
analyzed: de phyir sa dbang mchog gis pha ma dag dang lhan cig 'gro ba bdag la dgag ma mdzad //
translated: Therefore, O king, do not prevent me from going with my parents.

original: de nas rgyal po des 'gro ba mngon @66b par rjes su gnang ste sngo bsangs pha ma dag la kun nas dmigs te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po des 'gro ba mngon @66b par rjes su gnang ste sngo bsangs pha ma dag la kun nas dmigs te /
translated: Then the king gave permission for the people to leave.

original: bral ba las yang dag par 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis nye bar bsags pa'i mchi mas mig rnyog pa dang ldan pa rjes su 'gro zhing /
analyzed: bral ba las yang dag par 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis nye bar bsags pa'i mchi mas mig rnyog pa dang ldan pa rjes su 'gro zhing /
translated: With eyes filled with tears that were produced from the suffering of separation, he followed the parents of Kṛṣṇa.

original: nye ba dang grogs po'i skye bo rnam par bzlog nas /
analyzed: nye ba dang grogs po'i skye bo rnam par bzlog nas /
translated: He turned back the people who were his friends and relatives.

original: ri dags rnams kyi sos gcod pa'i mi mnyam pa'i ku sha dang rtsva'i myu gus sngo ba'i mthil dang / skya rengs kyi shing rta 'dren pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis kun nas tsha ba las skyes pa'i dbugs kyis mgrin pa la skyod pa'i rma bya rnams kyi shing rnams kyi grib ma la lhag par gnas pa dang /
analyzed: ri dags rnams kyi sos gcod pa'i mi mnyam pa'i ku sha dang rtsva'i myu gus sngo ba'i mthil dang / skya rengs kyi shing rta 'dren pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis kun nas tsha ba las skyes pa'i dbugs kyis mgrin pa la skyod pa'i rma bya rnams kyi shing rnams kyi grib ma la lhag par gnas pa dang /
translated: He stayed in the shade of the trees of the peacocks that were agitated by the breath that arose from the heat of the uneven kuśa and grass shoots that were chewed by the deer, and by the rays that pulled the chariot of the dawn.

original: phag pa rnams kyi snas rlogs pa'i mon lug gi tshogs kyi rdzing gi 'gram du 'brel pa dur pa pho mo gnyis kyis sgra sgrogs pa dang / ka ko la bcag pa ltar dri zhim po'i glang po che'i smyon chu'i dris nang du bsgos par byas pa dang /
analyzed: phag pa rnams kyi snas rlogs pa'i mon lug gi tshogs kyi rdzing gi 'gram du 'brel pa dur pa pho mo gnyis kyis sgra sgrogs pa dang / ka ko la bcag pa ltar dri zhim po'i glang po che'i smyon chu'i dris nang du bsgos par byas pa dang /
translated: and the sound of the mating of the male and female ospreys on the banks of the lake of the herd of deer that are the objects of the pigs' snouts,🔽and the fragrance of the ichor of the rutting elephants, which is like the smell of broken cardamom seeds, and the various forms stirred up by the wind,🔽and the hanging vines with their flowers, and the birds that climb up them, and the sweet songs of the swarms of bees,

original: rlung gis bsgul ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / me tog 'byung ba'i shing gel ba rnams la 'phyang ba la 'dzeg pa dang / sbrang byed kyi tshogs kyis glu blangs pa'i zhi ba'i dgon pa rim dang rim gyis rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung gis bsgul ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / me tog 'byung ba'i shing gel ba rnams la 'phyang ba la 'dzeg pa dang / sbrang byed kyi tshogs kyis glu blangs pa'i zhi ba'i dgon pa rim dang rim gyis rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the peaceful forest, which is reached by stages.

original: de dag 'gro ba gang dang gang du kun nas 'dod 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de dag 'gro ba gang dang gang du kun nas 'dod 'gyur ba //
translated: Wherever they go, they are completely desired.

original: long ba bla ma dag ni mi mnyam rdo 'gegs nags lam la //
analyzed: long ba bla ma dag ni mi mnyam rdo 'gegs nags lam la //
translated: The blind gurus, unevenly stumbling on the rocky path of the forest,

original: brtse bas 'jam pa'i sems la de dang der ni sdug bsngal ni //
analyzed: brtse bas 'jam pa'i sems la de dang der ni sdug bsngal ni //
translated: with their minds full of love, suffer here and there.

original: de la shin tu rno ba khros min dug ltar 'bab par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la shin tu rno ba khros min dug ltar 'bab par 'gyur //
translated: But they are not very sharp, not angry, and do not pour out like poison.

original: mi mnyam pa'i sa phyogs la yang phrag pas khur te byang chub sems dpa' shing gi rtsa ba 'ga' zhig tu pha ma dag la zar bcug nas slar langs te /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i sa phyogs la yang phrag pas khur te byang chub sems dpa' shing gi rtsa ba 'ga' zhig tu pha ma dag la zar bcug nas slar langs te /
translated: He carried his parents on his shoulders to an uneven place and made them sit down at the base of a tree.

original: phyi dro'i dus su lam cung zad du song ste su dag yang dag par 'ongs pa dang phrad nas /
analyzed: phyi dro'i dus su lam cung zad du song ste su dag yang dag par 'ongs pa dang phrad nas /
translated: Then he stood up and went a short distance on the road in the afternoon. He met some people who had come to gather wood.

original: shing pa la sha'i 'dab ma rnams kyis dpral ba 'gebs pa yang ma yin pa mthong ba dang / gzhu dang ldan pa dang phrag pa gnyis la mda' dang bcas pa'i dong pa bcings pa dang / mig dang 'gram pa shin tu dma' ba dang /
analyzed: shing pa la sha'i 'dab ma rnams kyis dpral ba 'gebs pa yang ma yin pa mthong ba dang / gzhu dang ldan pa dang phrag pa gnyis la mda' dang bcas pa'i dong pa bcings pa dang / mig dang 'gram pa shin tu dma' ba dang /
translated: He saw that they did not cover their foreheads with the leaves of the palasha tree, that they were armed with bows, that they had quivers strapped to their shoulders, and that their eyes and cheeks were very sunken.

original: kun nas rtsub cing ser skya dang srab pa'i skra dang sma ra'i tshogs dang ldan pa dang / rma bya'i mdongs kyi sgros rna ba dkris par brtsams pa dang lcag kyi ka ba ltar sngo ba'i go cha dang ldan ba dang / nags kyi gtam dbang po las ma 'das pa nags na spyod pa la dris par gyur to //
analyzed: kun nas rtsub cing ser skya dang srab pa'i skra dang sma ra'i tshogs dang ldan pa dang / rma bya'i mdongs kyi sgros rna ba dkris par brtsams pa dang lcag kyi ka ba ltar sngo ba'i go cha dang ldan ba dang / nags kyi gtam dbang po las ma 'das pa nags na spyod pa la dris par gyur to //
translated: He was covered with a mass of rough, tawny, thin hair and beard, and his ears were adorned with peacock feathers. He was clad in armor that was blue like the trunk of a plantain tree, and he was a forest-dweller, having not passed beyond the state of a forest animal.🔽He asked, In which direction is the hermitage of the good sage Agastya?

original: bzang po'i gdong sa phyogs gang na slar dka' thub kyi nags yong @67a * //
analyzed: bzang po'i gdong sa phyogs gang na slar dka' thub kyi nags yong @67a * //
translated: He replied, The hermitage of the good sage Agastya is in the southern direction.

original: ces zer ro //
analyzed: ces zer ro //
translated: He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.

original: des kyang gsong por smra ba dang / gus pas de la gzhu'i rtse mos bstan par gyur te /
analyzed: des kyang gsong por smra ba dang / gus pas de la gzhu'i rtse mos bstan par gyur te /
translated: He said, I am going there.

original: 'phags pas lta bar 'os te gang la 'di //🔽phyed ni zad pa ae ma gu dha ni rdo bar rnam par bkod nas smin pas ser skyar bcas //
analyzed: 'phags pas lta bar 'os te gang la 'di // phyed ni zad pa ae ma gu dha ni rdo bar rnam par bkod nas smin pas ser skyar bcas //
translated: He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.

original: ku sha'i dag byed lag pa gyen du byas nas rim gyis spang bya'i gdan las langs nas ni //
analyzed: ku sha'i dag byed lag pa gyen du byas nas rim gyis spang bya'i gdan las langs nas ni //
translated: He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.🔽He said, I am going there.

original: ma rmos s'a lu sdud par byed cing lto ba dang ni rab 'brel rkang gnyis ne tso ni //
analyzed: ma rmos s'a lu sdud par byed cing lto ba dang ni rab 'brel rkang gnyis ne tso ni //
translated: The parrot, with its beak, was gathering unplanted rice, and was tied to the belly of a two-legged bird.

original: ma la gyen du bteg pa'i gdong dang ldan pa dka' thub pa yi bu ni smra bar byed //
analyzed: ma la gyen du bteg pa'i gdong dang ldan pa dka' thub pa yi bu ni smra bar byed //
translated: The son of the ascetic, with his face raised to his mother, speaks.

original: sa phyogs 'di na dka' thub kyi nags yod de /
analyzed: sa phyogs 'di na dka' thub kyi nags yod de /
translated: Here is the forest of asceticism.🔽'The noble one, together with his elder brother, should go to the forest of asceticism to increase his austerities.

original: 'phags pa bla ma'i skye bo dang bcas pa dka' thub 'phel ba'i phyir shig / sngo bsangs kyis kyang de ltar bya'o zhes brjod nas nags na rgyu ba de la shis pa brjod pa byin nas dka' thub kyi nags su zhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa bla ma'i skye bo dang bcas pa dka' thub 'phel ba'i phyir shig / sngo bsangs kyis kyang de ltar bya'o zhes brjod nas nags na rgyu ba de la shis pa brjod pa byin nas dka' thub kyi nags su zhugs par gyur te /
translated: 'The dark one should also do the same.' Having said this, he gave him a blessing for wandering in the forest, and entered the forest of asceticism.

original: dka' thub nor ltar su zhig chung //
analyzed: dka' thub nor ltar su zhig chung //
translated: Who is small like the wealth of asceticism?

original: gzhan ni 'bras bu zhim po'i ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'bras bu zhim po'i ro //
translated: The other is the taste of delicious fruit.

original: legs par 'ongs sam zhes brjod nas //
analyzed: legs par 'ongs sam zhes brjod nas //
translated: Having said, 'Welcome,'

original: de la khri snyan pags pa byin //
analyzed: de la khri snyan pags pa byin //
translated: he gave him the skin of a heavenly elephant.

original: nags rnams sam ni khyim du yang //
analyzed: nags rnams sam ni khyim du yang //
translated: In the forests or in the home,

original: dam pas yun ring gnas byed pa //
analyzed: dam pas yun ring gnas byed pa //
translated: The noble one should stay for a long time.

original: ji ltar rigs par don gnyer phan //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par don gnyer phan //
translated: As is fitting, he should benefit those who seek him.

original: chos 'dod pas ni bya ba ste //
analyzed: chos 'dod pas ni bya ba ste //
translated: One who desires the Dharma should act thus.

original: chu shing me tog tshogs ltar sngo //
analyzed: chu shing me tog tshogs ltar sngo //
translated: like a cluster of plantain flowers.

original: de nas spyil po de mthong nas //
analyzed: de nas spyil po de mthong nas //
translated: Then, seeing that hut,

original: sngo med sems ldan sngo bsangs kyi //
analyzed: sngo med sems ldan sngo bsangs kyi //
translated: the blue-complexioned one, whose mind was free from thoughts of blue,

original: yid la 'di ltar re ba gyur //
analyzed: yid la 'di ltar re ba gyur //
translated: thought this:

original: gzung ba yang dag 'jug pa padma'i rtsa ba gnas //
analyzed: gzung ba yang dag 'jug pa padma'i rtsa ba gnas //
translated: “The lotus root, which is the object of his meditation, is his home;

original: thun gsum mar gyi sreg lugs du mas dri byas pa //
analyzed: thun gsum mar gyi sreg lugs du mas dri byas pa //
translated: the three periods of the night, which he spends in the practice of yoga, are his food;

original: 'dug cing langs dang 'gro ba'i ri dags 'ga' zhig tu //
analyzed: 'dug cing langs dang 'gro ba'i ri dags 'ga' zhig tu //
translated: the deer, which he sees sitting, standing, and walking, are his friends;

original: srid pa 'don pa byas pa'i lam gyi rgyu mtshan yin //
analyzed: srid pa 'don pa byas pa'i lam gyi rgyu mtshan yin //
translated: and the path, which he follows in order to escape from existence, is his reason for living.

original: rab zhi srid 'joms 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: rab zhi srid 'joms 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor rnams kyis ni //
translated: The ascetics, who are intent on destroying existence and on attaining peace,

original: dka' thub nags 'di shing los byas pa'i khyim brten pa //
analyzed: dka' thub nags 'di shing los byas pa'i khyim brten pa //
translated: have made this forest of asceticism their home, which is made of leaves.

original: yan lag med kyang gzhu ni spangs nas zhugs zin te //
analyzed: yan lag med kyang gzhu ni spangs nas zhugs zin te //
translated: Even the one who is without limbs has taken up the bow and entered the forest;

original: zhi ba mngon 'dod mchog gi skye bos smos ci dgos //
analyzed: zhi ba mngon 'dod mchog gi skye bos smos ci dgos //
translated: what need to speak of the one who desires peace and is a great man?

original: de nas dka' thub kyi nor can de rnams dang lhan cig tu mtshan mo gcig der gnas te tho rangs kyi dus su byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dben pa'i bde ba 'dod cing dka' thub kyi nags de las tha dad pa dga' bar gyur pa shing lo'i
analyzed: de nas dka' thub kyi nor can de rnams dang lhan cig tu mtshan mo gcig der gnas te tho rangs kyi dus su byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dben pa'i bde ba 'dod cing dka' thub kyi nags de las tha dad pa dga' bar gyur pa shing lo'i
translated: Then, together with those ascetics, he stayed there for one night. At dawn, the Bodhisattva, desiring the bliss of solitude, left that forest of austerities and went to a different place that was delightful,

original: ra ba chen po byas par gyur te /
analyzed: ra ba chen po byas par gyur te /
translated: where there was a large hut made of leaves.

original: gus pas bla ma dag ni spyod cing bla ma'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gus pas bla ma dag ni spyod cing bla ma'i rang bzhin te /
translated: He was respectful to the gurus, and had the nature of a guru.

original: me la mchod cing mi chung ba @67b dang brtan pa mthong ba'i blo //
analyzed: me la mchod cing mi chung ba @67b dang brtan pa mthong ba'i blo //
translated: He made offerings to the fire, was not small, and had a mind that saw stability.

original: mnyam pa'i yid ldan rang skye dang ni skye bo blo mang ba //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i yid ldan rang skye dang ni skye bo blo mang ba //
translated: He had an attitude of equality, was born from himself, and had a mind of many births.

original: gnas de la ni dka' thub kun nas spyod cing gnas par gyur //
analyzed: gnas de la ni dka' thub kun nas spyod cing gnas par gyur //
translated: He lived in that place, practicing asceticism in every way.

original: de nas dus gcig gi tshe na bdag nyid chen po de nags kyi ri gzhan las me tog 'bras bu dang bud shing dang ku sha rnams blangs te /
analyzed: de nas dus gcig gi tshe na bdag nyid chen po de nags kyi ri gzhan las me tog 'bras bu dang bud shing dang ku sha rnams blangs te /
translated: Then, at one time, that great being took flowers, fruits, firewood, and kuśa grass from another forest mountain.

original: shing lo'i khyim gyis gzhi la byug pa 'jam po byas te /
analyzed: shing lo'i khyim gyis gzhi la byug pa 'jam po byas te /
translated: He made a smooth ointment on the ground of the leaf house.

original: rkang lag dag la khrus byas shing bum pa blangs nas /
analyzed: rkang lag dag la khrus byas shing bum pa blangs nas /
translated: He washed his hands and feet and took the water pot.

original: ri dags kyi phru gu rjes su 'gro bzhin pa /🔽lcang ma'i ljon shing mang po rab tu rgyas pa'i 'gram kun nas bkag pa /
analyzed: ri dags kyi phru gu rjes su 'gro bzhin pa / lcang ma'i ljon shing mang po rab tu rgyas pa'i 'gram kun nas bkag pa /
translated: The young deer followed behind him.🔽He went to a river with its banks crowded with many flourishing bamboo trees.

original: nor bu dkar po bcad pa ltar dri ma med pa dang / bsil zhing zhim pa'i chu 'bab pa'i chu bo'i drung du song ste /
analyzed: nor bu dkar po bcad pa ltar dri ma med pa dang / bsil zhing zhim pa'i chu 'bab pa'i chu bo'i drung du song ste /
translated: The water was clear like a cut piece of white crystal, cool and sweet.

original: pags pa dang ni bgrang phreng dag / shing gi yal ga la dpyangs nas //
analyzed: pags pa dang ni bgrang phreng dag / shing gi yal ga la dpyangs nas //
translated: He hung his deerskin and rosary on a tree branch.

original: bsil chu dag la khrus byas pa //
analyzed: bsil chu dag la khrus byas pa //
translated: He bathed in the cool water.

original: bde phyir chu ni 'dzin par gyur //🔽rtsva ni sngon po bsten byas nas //
analyzed: bde phyir chu ni 'dzin par gyur // rtsva ni sngon po bsten byas nas //
translated: He drank the water for the sake of pleasure.🔽He ate some fresh green grass.

original: dri ma med pa'i chu 'thungs te //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i chu 'thungs te //
translated: He drank the clear water.

original: khrus byas ri dags phrug pa de //
analyzed: khrus byas ri dags phrug pa de //
translated: He bathed and the young deer

original: 'dug cing so sor brkyang bar gyis //
analyzed: 'dug cing so sor brkyang bar gyis //
translated: sat down and stretched out.

original: de nas rgyal po tshangs pas byin sgra la phog pa ri dags kyi lings las skyo bsangs nyams su myong zhing myur du 'gro ba'i rtas 'gugs bzhin pa chu bo'i 'gram der 'ongs nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po tshangs pas byin sgra la phog pa ri dags kyi lings las skyo bsangs nyams su myong zhing myur du 'gro ba'i rtas 'gugs bzhin pa chu bo'i 'gram der 'ongs nas /
translated: Then King Brahmadatta, who had been hunting deer, came to the riverbank, his horses galloping, his mind filled with the sorrow of killing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chu 'dzin pa las skyes pa'i chu'i sgra la mnyan nas 'gram gyi shing dang shing gel ba rnams kyis lta ba'i bar du chod par byas pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chu 'dzin pa las skyes pa'i chu'i sgra la mnyan nas 'gram gyi shing dang shing gel ba rnams kyis lta ba'i bar du chod par byas pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva, hearing the sound of the water from the riverbank, was hidden by the trees and shrubs on the bank.

original: nges par chu bo 'di la phag gam ri dags 'jug pa zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas /
analyzed: nges par chu bo 'di la phag gam ri dags 'jug pa zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas /
translated: Thinking, Surely, a boar or a deer is entering the river,

original: gang las sgra de byung ba des mda' 'phangs par gyur to //
analyzed: gang las sgra de byung ba des mda' 'phangs par gyur to //
translated: he shot an arrow from where the sound came.

original: de nas mda' ni mde'u chen po dang ldan pas //
analyzed: de nas mda' ni mde'u chen po dang ldan pas //
translated: Then, with an arrow having a large head,

original: brang gi dbus su bdag nyid chen po de 'bigs te //
analyzed: brang gi dbus su bdag nyid chen po de 'bigs te //
translated: he pierced the great being in the middle of the chest.

original: de chog sgra las nang gi bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba //
analyzed: de chog sgra las nang gi bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba //
translated: From that sound, the inner suffering of the one who was suffering

original: 'gram las ri dags phrug pa yang ni langs par gyur //
analyzed: 'gram las ri dags phrug pa yang ni langs par gyur //
translated: rose up like a young deer from the bank.

original: su yis bdag ni 'bigs pa zhes bya gang 'di shes byas nas //
analyzed: su yis bdag ni 'bigs pa zhes bya gang 'di shes byas nas //
translated: “Who has pierced me?” Having understood this,

original: sa yi bdag po de yi snying rje'i bdag nyid can gyis ni //
analyzed: sa yi bdag po de yi snying rje'i bdag nyid can gyis ni //
translated: the lord of the earth, whose nature was compassionate,

original: 'di ni su yin zhes bya rta las myur du babs nas kyang //
analyzed: 'di ni su yin zhes bya rta las myur du babs nas kyang //
translated: quickly dismounted from his horse, saying, “Who is this?”

original: brang gi dkyil na mda' ni sbyor ba sngo bsangs mthong bar gyur //
analyzed: brang gi dkyil na mda' ni sbyor ba sngo bsangs mthong bar gyur //
translated: and saw the blue arrow lodged in his chest.

original: rgyal po des kyang yun ring pos ni de shes nas //
analyzed: rgyal po des kyang yun ring pos ni de shes nas //
translated: The king, having understood it after a long time,

original: sngo bsangs 'di zhes mig la mchi ma 'byung ba ni //🔽zhing gi tshogs la sbas pa 'di ni smra ba ste //
analyzed: sngo bsangs 'di zhes mig la mchi ma 'byung ba ni // zhing gi tshogs la sbas pa 'di ni smra ba ste //
translated: said with tears in his eyes, “This is Nīlāmbara.🔽This one hidden in the herd of fields is the one who spoke.

original: ri dags 'di zhes 'dir ni @68a * //
analyzed: ri dags 'di zhes 'dir ni @68a * //
translated: This deer,

original: bdag gis khyod 'bigs pa //
analyzed: bdag gis khyod 'bigs pa //
translated: whom I pierced here,

original: g-yo ba rnams kyis bag med skyon las sdug bsngal ba //
analyzed: g-yo ba rnams kyis bag med skyon las sdug bsngal ba //
translated: is suffering from the fault of carelessness among the moving ones.

original: gang du 'di 'dra dam pa rnams la yang ni byed //🔽ri dags lings kyi sdug bsngal de las mi rnams la //
analyzed: gang du 'di 'dra dam pa rnams la yang ni byed // ri dags lings kyi sdug bsngal de las mi rnams la //
translated: Where is this kind of goodness even for the noble ones?🔽For humans, there is no other suffering more difficult than

original: sdug bsngal shin tu dka' pa gzhan ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shin tu dka' pa gzhan ni yod ma yin //
translated: the suffering of a deer in a snare.

original: mi skyong sgra yis rgyags pa dregs pa rmongs pa yi //
analyzed: mi skyong sgra yis rgyags pa dregs pa rmongs pa yi //
translated: The arrogant, intoxicated, and deluded

original: rnam ltung mngon par phyogs pa bag med bsnyen pa yang //
analyzed: rnam ltung mngon par phyogs pa bag med bsnyen pa yang //
translated: And you are not heedless, but are intent on falling.

original: snying rje la ni dmigs nas zhi ba'i gzugs ldan lags //
analyzed: snying rje la ni dmigs nas zhi ba'i gzugs ldan lags //
translated: You are compassionate, and you have the form of peace.🔽Do not kill me with the arrow of your reproach.

original: tsha ba'i smod mo'i mda' yis bdag ni ma bsad cig / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sa'i bdag po de ltar smod pa la rtse gcig pa phyi nas 'gyod pas kun nas song ba'i yid smod mo 'byung ba la dogs pa brten par byas par gyur te
analyzed: tsha ba'i smod mo'i mda' yis bdag ni ma bsad cig / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sa'i bdag po de ltar smod pa la rtse gcig pa phyi nas 'gyod pas kun nas song ba'i yid smod mo 'byung ba la dogs pa brten par byas par gyur te
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, the Lord of the Earth, having thus been reproached, his mind was filled with remorse.

original: / rgyal po chen po bdag las smod pa'i dogs pas chog ste /🔽shin tu khros pa'i dbang gis kyang ni khyod kyis ni //
analyzed: / rgyal po chen po bdag las smod pa'i dogs pas chog ste / shin tu khros pa'i dbang gis kyang ni khyod kyis ni //
translated: He said to the arrow: Great King, it is enough to suspect me of reproach.🔽Even if you were to shoot me out of anger,

original: gal te bdag la mda' ni phog par gyur ba ste //
analyzed: gal te bdag la mda' ni phog par gyur ba ste //
translated: even if your arrow were to strike me,

original: de lta na yang bdag gi sems ni gzhan du yang //
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag gi sems ni gzhan du yang //
translated: my mind would not turn to anything else.

original: 'byung ba min te skyon bral khyod la smos ci dgos //
analyzed: 'byung ba min te skyon bral khyod la smos ci dgos //
translated: What need is there to mention you, who are free of fault?

original: 'on kyang sngon du byas pa'i las rnams 'di dag gis //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon du byas pa'i las rnams 'di dag gis //
translated: But these actions of mine in the past

original: mda' yi gzugs kyis bdag gi brang la brgyab pa ni //
analyzed: mda' yi gzugs kyis bdag gi brang la brgyab pa ni //
translated: have struck my chest in the form of an arrow.

original: de ltar khyod la 'dir ni khyod la nyes pa ci zhig ste //
analyzed: de ltar khyod la 'dir ni khyod la nyes pa ci zhig ste //
translated: So what is your crime here?

original: mi skyong smod pa'i 'jigs pa kun nas dor bar gyis //
analyzed: mi skyong smod pa'i 'jigs pa kun nas dor bar gyis //
translated: Throw off completely the fear of being censured by the people.

original: skye bo yod na ci zhig 'jig pa min de bas //
analyzed: skye bo yod na ci zhig 'jig pa min de bas //
translated: If there are people, what is not destroyed?

original: bdag la shi ba'i 'jigs pa cung zad kyang ni med //
analyzed: bdag la shi ba'i 'jigs pa cung zad kyang ni med //
translated: I have not the slightest fear of death.

original: pha dang ma dang nags su mig dang bral ba la //
analyzed: pha dang ma dang nags su mig dang bral ba la //
translated: My father and mother are in the forest, deprived of their eyes,

original: kun nas bsams te bdag ni sdug bsngal nye bar song //
analyzed: kun nas bsams te bdag ni sdug bsngal nye bar song //
translated: and I, thinking of them, am close to suffering.

original: bdag ni dus kyi dbang gis srid pa gzhan dag tu //
analyzed: bdag ni dus kyi dbang gis srid pa gzhan dag tu //
translated: I, by the power of time, in other existences,🔽have been a king, a prince, a minister,🔽a brāhmaṇa, a kṣatriya, a vaiśya, and a śūdra.

original: di ring 'gro ba kun nas khyab cing khyab pa ni //
analyzed: di ring 'gro ba kun nas khyab cing khyab pa ni //
translated: Today, I am pervaded and pervade all beings.

original: skyed byed dang ni skyed pa po dag sdug bsngal ba //
analyzed: skyed byed dang ni skyed pa po dag sdug bsngal ba //
translated: The creator and the created are suffering.

original: long ba nags 'di la ni ci zhig byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: long ba nags 'di la ni ci zhig byed par 'gyur //
translated: What will I do in this blind forest?

original: sa yi skyong ba dag la ji srid bar du lus //
analyzed: sa yi skyong ba dag la ji srid bar du lus //
translated: As long as the rulers of the earth

original: 'di ni srog chags kun nas dor bar mi byed pa //
analyzed: 'di ni srog chags kun nas dor bar mi byed pa //
translated: do not abandon this body,🔽I will quickly abandon this suffering

original: dka' thub nags las bdag gis myur du pha ma dag / de srid sdug bsngal ba ni myur du spong bar byas //
analyzed: dka' thub nags las bdag gis myur du pha ma dag / de srid sdug bsngal ba ni myur du spong bar byas //
translated: from the forest of austerities, my father and mother.

original: cung zad rgas pa kun nas dris pa bskyod pa'i sor mo can //
analyzed: cung zad rgas pa kun nas dris pa bskyod pa'i sor mo can //
translated: His fingers are crooked, as if he were a little old man.

original: autpa la chen po rnyings pa ltar ni kun skya mdun lag gis //
analyzed: autpa la chen po rnyings pa ltar ni kun skya mdun lag gis //
translated: He is pale all over, like a faded lotus.

original: pha ma dag ni de la snying rje dang bcas reg 'gyur ba //
analyzed: pha ma dag ni de la snying rje dang bcas reg 'gyur ba //
translated: His parents touch him with pity.

original: bdag ni don byas de ring bde @68b bar srog ni btang bar bgyi //
analyzed: bdag ni don byas de ring bde @68b bar srog ni btang bar bgyi //
translated: I have fulfilled my purpose. Today I will give up my life.

original: 'di ltar yang bdag gi tshig gis pha ma dag la zhu bar bya ste /🔽mnyes ni gshin pa'i chu yis khyed cag gis //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang bdag gi tshig gis pha ma dag la zhu bar bya ste / mnyes ni gshin pa'i chu yis khyed cag gis //
translated: And I will ask my parents in these words:🔽“You have watered the tree of your son🔽with the water of your tears,

original: bu yi shing gang 'phel phyir chu yis sbangs pa ni //
analyzed: bu yi shing gang 'phel phyir chu yis sbangs pa ni //
translated: in order that it might grow.

original: gsong por smra ba'i me tog 'di //
analyzed: gsong por smra ba'i me tog 'di //
translated: This flower of my polite speech

original: de las tha ma kun nas gzung bar mdzod //
analyzed: de las tha ma kun nas gzung bar mdzod //
translated: you must now accept as a last gift.”

original: de nas rgyal po de dag gis mi dga' ba 'di de lta bu'i de dag la ji ltar smra bar bya zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas byang chub sems dpa' la smras pa /🔽khyod lta mda' yis 'bigs pa ni //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de dag gis mi dga' ba 'di de lta bu'i de dag la ji ltar smra bar bya zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas byang chub sems dpa' la smras pa / khyod lta mda' yis 'bigs pa ni //
translated: Then the king and queen, thinking, “How can we speak to him in this state?” said to the bodhisattva:🔽“If you are going to kill yourself

original: ngan 'gror 'gro ba bdag gis te //
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro ba bdag gis te //
translated: with this arrow, we will go to a bad rebirth.

original: mi dga' smra ba'i mda' yis ni //
analyzed: mi dga' smra ba'i mda' yis ni //
translated: The arrow of unpleasant speech🔽

original: de dag la yang ji ltar 'bigs //
analyzed: de dag la yang ji ltar 'bigs //
translated: How can I shoot them with the arrows of unpleasant speech?

original: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva said,

original: rgyal po chen po dus 'da' bas chog ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po dus 'da' bas chog ste /
translated: “Great King, enough with the delay.

original: bdag gi lus dug gis brgyal bar yongs su song bar 'dra bar kun nas dub pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi lus dug gis brgyal bar yongs su song bar 'dra bar kun nas dub pa ste /
translated: My body is completely overcome by the poison of despair.

original: de nas rgyal po de bya ba 'di sdig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba rnam par dpyad nas de ltar bya zhes khas blangs te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de bya ba 'di sdig pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba rnam par dpyad nas de ltar bya zhes khas blangs te /
translated: Then the king, having analyzed this matter as “this is sinful,” promised to do it that way.

original: de nyid du rta de yal ga la btags nas slob ma bzhin du dul ba 'dzin pa dka' thub kyi nags la mngon par phyogs pas zhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid du rta de yal ga la btags nas slob ma bzhin du dul ba 'dzin pa dka' thub kyi nags la mngon par phyogs pas zhugs par gyur te /
translated: He tied the horse to a branch right there, and like a student, he entered the forest of austerities, holding back his tears.

original: de na sa yi bdag po'i rkang pa'i sgra ni ring nas thos //
analyzed: de na sa yi bdag po'i rkang pa'i sgra ni ring nas thos //
translated: There, the sound of the king’s feet was heard from afar.

original: kun nas skams pa'i shing gi 'dab ma btsir nas byung ba ni //
analyzed: kun nas skams pa'i shing gi 'dab ma btsir nas byung ba ni //
translated: Having squeezed the leaves of a dry tree,

original: nges par chu ni lings pa sngo bsangs 'di ni 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: nges par chu ni lings pa sngo bsangs 'di ni 'ongs pa ste /
translated: “This dark blue water has definitely come.

original: de la gnas pa de dag 'di ltar phan tshun smra bar gyur //
analyzed: de la gnas pa de dag 'di ltar phan tshun smra bar gyur //
translated: Those who were staying there spoke to each other like this:

original: rgyal po de yang nye bar 'ongs nas mi dga' ba de smra bar ma nus shing sdug bsngal ba'i snying shing los byas pa'i ra ba'i nye 'khor dang nye bar 'ongs te cang mi smra bar gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyal po de yang nye bar 'ongs nas mi dga' ba de smra bar ma nus shing sdug bsngal ba'i snying shing los byas pa'i ra ba'i nye 'khor dang nye bar 'ongs te cang mi smra bar gnas par gyur to //
translated: The king also approached, but was unable to speak his displeasure. With a heart made of wood, he approached the vicinity of the fence and remained silent.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i ma sngo bsangs 'di 'ongs so zhes bya ba rnam par bsams par gyur pas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i ma sngo bsangs 'di 'ongs so zhes bya ba rnam par bsams par gyur pas smras pa /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva's mother, Yasodharā, having thought, He has come, said:

original: bum ba blangs nas chu yi phyir ni chu bor nyer 'ongs te //
analyzed: bum ba blangs nas chu yi phyir ni chu bor nyer 'ongs te //
translated: Having taken the pot, you have come to the river for water.

original: ci phyir de ring bu khyod yun ring nas ni nyer 'ongs pa /
analyzed: ci phyir de ring bu khyod yun ring nas ni nyer 'ongs pa /
translated: Why have you, my son, come so long today?🔽Having offered the fire sacrifice, take the rice and lotuses,

original: me ni mchod nas 'bras bu dang ni padma rnams long shig /'dab ma'i snod la bkod nas khyed kyi pha ni bkres pa ste //
analyzed: me ni mchod nas 'bras bu dang ni padma rnams long shig /'dab ma'i snod la bkod nas khyed kyi pha ni bkres pa ste //
translated: and having arranged them in a leaf-vessel, your father is hungry.

original: de nas tshangs pas byin gyis gsong por smra ba ste /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pas byin gyis gsong por smra ba ste /
translated: Then Brahmadatta, with a pleasant voice,

original: bdag nyid ngo shes par byas pa de dag la ma brtags par byas pa de nyid kyi nyes par spyad pa de smras par gyur to //
analyzed: bdag nyid ngo shes par byas pa de dag la ma brtags par byas pa de nyid kyi nyes par spyad pa de smras par gyur to //
translated: without examining those who had made themselves known, spoke of that very misdeed.

original: de dag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sdug bsngal thos te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sdug bsngal thos te /
translated: They too heard of the Bodhisattva’s suffering,

original: kye ma zhes brjod cing @69a * //
analyzed: kye ma zhes brjod cing @69a * //
translated: and cried out, “Alas!

original: brgyal bar nye bar song bar gyur to //
analyzed: brgyal bar nye bar song bar gyur to //
translated: They almost fainted.

original: yun ring pos kyang 'du shes byung ba de dang der smre sngags bton nas smras par gyur pa /
analyzed: yun ring pos kyang 'du shes byung ba de dang der smre sngags bton nas smras par gyur pa /
translated: After a long time, they regained consciousness and lamented,

original: ji srid de yi lus ni kun nas ma btang ba //
analyzed: ji srid de yi lus ni kun nas ma btang ba //
translated: “As long as his body is not completely released,

original: bya dang ce spyang rnams kyis rnyings pa byed pa ni //
analyzed: bya dang ce spyang rnams kyis rnyings pa byed pa ni //
translated: the birds and jackals will make it old.

original: mi dbang bdag cag rnams ni snying rjes de drung du ;
analyzed: mi dbang bdag cag rnams ni snying rjes de drung du ;
translated: We, the lords of men, out of compassion for him,

original: / sdug bsngal skal can khyod kyis myur du re zhig khrid //
analyzed: / sdug bsngal skal can khyod kyis myur du re zhig khrid //
translated: will quickly lead you, who are destined for suffering, to him.”

original: de nas rgyal po de dag nye bar bzung nas mda'i rma las skyes pa'i rgyal bas rnam par btsums pa'i mig can /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de dag nye bar bzung nas mda'i rma las skyes pa'i rgyal bas rnam par btsums pa'i mig can /
translated: Then, taking the kings, whose eyes were closed by the arrows that had grown from the wounds,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gan du 'ongs par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gan du 'ongs par gyur to //
translated: they came into the presence of the Bodhisattva.

original: de nas ma bu kye ma bu zhes zer zhing sdug bsngal gyi dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' la 'khyud nas brgyal bar nye bar song bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas ma bu kye ma bu zhes zer zhing sdug bsngal gyi dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' la 'khyud nas brgyal bar nye bar song bar gyur to //
translated: Then, with the cry, “Alas, my son!” she fell into a faint, overcome by her sorrow, and clung to the Bodhisattva.

original: mdun na 'don pa des kyang snying rje dang bcas par smre sngags 'don pa'i phyir brtsams te /
analyzed: mdun na 'don pa des kyang snying rje dang bcas par smre sngags 'don pa'i phyir brtsams te /
translated: The family priest, too, began to lament with compassion:

original: stegs bu pas ni nyer byugs nas //
analyzed: stegs bu pas ni nyer byugs nas //
translated: “The altar has been anointed,

original: me tog mchod pa yang byas te //
analyzed: me tog mchod pa yang byas te //
translated: and the flower offering made.

original: di ring sngags ni ster bzhin du //
analyzed: di ring sngags ni ster bzhin du //
translated: Today, as the mantra is being given,

original: me la bud shing ltung bar gyur//
analyzed: me la bud shing ltung bar gyur//
translated: the fuel falls into the fire.

original: rgas pa'i mdas ni phog pas bya ba rnam bral ba //
analyzed: rgas pa'i mdas ni phog pas bya ba rnam bral ba //
translated: Struck by the arrow of old age, you are bereft of action.🔽You have long dwelt in this forest of austerities,

original: dka' thub rnams kyis 'od med nyam chung yan lag gi / dka' thub nags 'dir gnas pa yun ring du ni byung //
analyzed: dka' thub rnams kyis 'od med nyam chung yan lag gi / dka' thub nags 'dir gnas pa yun ring du ni byung //
translated: dimmed by asceticism, weak, your limbs emaciated.🔽You are the eyes of the blind, of me and of all others.

original: mig med dag dang kho bo cag gi khyod ni mig /'di ni bu yi rang bzhin mig ni chen po ste //
analyzed: mig med dag dang kho bo cag gi khyod ni mig /'di ni bu yi rang bzhin mig ni chen po ste //
translated: This is the nature of a son, a great eye.

original: mun pa dang bral skyon ni med pas 'phrog byed pas //
analyzed: mun pa dang bral skyon ni med pas 'phrog byed pas //
