analyzed: mang ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'khor gyis brgyan pa ni //
translated: The many various kinds of retinue are an ornament;

original: bde ba don gnyer rnams kyis spangs pa nyid du song na yang //
analyzed: bde ba don gnyer rnams kyis spangs pa nyid du song na yang //
translated: but when they are lost, those who seek happiness should abandon them.

original: khyim gyi gnas ni lha yi dbang gis byung ba ste//
analyzed: khyim gyi gnas ni lha yi dbang gis byung ba ste//
translated: The abode of the household is the source of divine power;

original: rma bya'i tshogs ltar zad pa dang ldan slar yang ni //
analyzed: rma bya'i tshogs ltar zad pa dang ldan slar yang ni //
translated: but like a flock of peacocks, it is subject to destruction.

original: yo byad rnams la ma rnyed pa nyid zhi ba'i rgyu //
analyzed: yo byad rnams la ma rnyed pa nyid zhi ba'i rgyu //
translated: The non-acquisition of possessions is the cause of peace.

original: skyon ni mang bas 'jigs par byed pa rnams la ni //
analyzed: skyon ni mang bas 'jigs par byed pa rnams la ni //
translated: For those who are frightened by the many faults,

original: gsal ba'i sngags kyi khyad kyi nus pa dman pa ni //
analyzed: gsal ba'i sngags kyi khyad kyi nus pa dman pa ni //
translated: The power of the mantras of the clear ones is weak.

original: rang nyid gsod chen drag po'i lto 'phye reg byed su //
analyzed: rang nyid gsod chen drag po'i lto 'phye reg byed su //
translated: Some are killed by the great fierce belly-crawlers.

original: 'dir ni la la du ste gzhan ni 'dod pa can //🔽gzhan ni dgod de khro ba gzhan rnams la //
analyzed: 'dir ni la la du ste gzhan ni 'dod pa can // gzhan ni dgod de khro ba gzhan rnams la //
translated: Some are lustful here, others are desirous.🔽Others laugh, others are angry.

original: gzhan ni rgud pa la ni smre sngags 'don //
analyzed: gzhan ni rgud pa la ni smre sngags 'don //
translated: Others lament in misfortune.

original: 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten gar bya ba dang mtshungs //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten gar bya ba dang mtshungs //
translated: The world of life is like a dance.

original: kye ma dpal gyis yun ring yang ni rjes skyong ba //
analyzed: kye ma dpal gyis yun ring yang ni rjes skyong ba //
translated: Alas! For a long time, prosperity follows.

original: sbrul gyi lce ltar bskyod pa skye bo la ni nor //
analyzed: sbrul gyi lce ltar bskyod pa skye bo la ni nor //
translated: Like the tongue of a snake, it moves among people.

original: rgas dang 'chi bas mngon par mnan pa'i 'gro ba la //
analyzed: rgas dang 'chi bas mngon par mnan pa'i 'gro ba la //
translated: The world is oppressed by old age and death.

original: gang gis skye bo gson po nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis skye bo gson po nyid du 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: By what means will people go to the land of the living?

original: de phyir khyim du gnas pa'i kun nas ngal ba'i sdug bsngal 'di //
analyzed: de phyir khyim du gnas pa'i kun nas ngal ba'i sdug bsngal 'di //
translated: Therefore, this suffering of complete exhaustion in the home

original: dor nas tshul khrims kyi ni rnyed sla zhi ba'i bde 'dod cing //
analyzed: dor nas tshul khrims kyi ni rnyed sla zhi ba'i bde 'dod cing //
translated: Having abandoned it, I desire the easy attainment of morality, the peace of happiness.

original: chos kyi khyim ni ngal ldan rnams la ngal ba 'jig pa'i rgyud //
analyzed: chos kyi khyim ni ngal ldan rnams la ngal ba 'jig pa'i rgyud //
translated: The Dharma home is the cause of destroying exhaustion for the exhausted.

original: zhi ba zhi phyir zhi ba'i rgyun la bdag gis brten par bgyi //
analyzed: zhi ba zhi phyir zhi ba'i rgyun la bdag gis brten par bgyi //
translated: I will rely on the stream of peace for the sake of peace.

original: de ltar rnam par bsams nas byang chub sems dpa' khyim la gnas pa'i chags pa dor ba khri snyan sa le'i bags pa dang / gtsang byed dang / spyi'u blugs 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par bsams nas byang chub sems dpa' khyim la gnas pa'i chags pa dor ba khri snyan sa le'i bags pa dang / gtsang byed dang / spyi'u blugs 'dzin pa /
translated: Having reflected in this way, the Bodhisattva, who has given up attachment to living in a home, having given away his throne, his elephant, his horse, his jewelry, his servants, his Śakra-like wealth, and so on,

original: zhi ba'i yid can rgya chen po'i nor gyi tshogs don du gnyer ba rnams la rab tu byin nas /
analyzed: zhi ba'i yid can rgya chen po'i nor gyi tshogs don du gnyer ba rnams la rab tu byin nas /
translated: having given away his great wealth to those who have a peaceful mind and seek a great accumulation of wealth,

original: rang gi khyim nas nges par byung ste /
analyzed: rang gi khyim nas nges par byung ste /
translated: having definitely left his home,

original: nye ba'i ri dri ma med pa'i chu dang ldan pa chu'i rten can bung ba'i tshogs kyis kun nas myang bzhin ba'i autpa la chen po'o ro dang / aa smra dang / 'dzam bu dang / pa na sa'i nags kyi grib mas 'gram gyi mtha' 'gegs pa 'ga' zhig la brten nas shing gi rtsa ba la /
analyzed: nye ba'i ri dri ma med pa'i chu dang ldan pa chu'i rten can bung ba'i tshogs kyis kun nas myang bzhin ba'i autpa la chen po'o ro dang / aa smra dang / 'dzam bu dang / pa na sa'i nags kyi grib mas 'gram gyi mtha' 'gegs pa 'ga' zhig la brten nas shing gi rtsa ba la /
translated: having gone to a certain place on a nearby mountain that has pure water, a place that is enjoyed by swarms of bees that drink from the great utpala flowers, the asoka trees, the rosewoods, and the pānaśa trees, a place that is shaded by the forest,

original: rtsva'i mal rnam par brtsams /
analyzed: rtsva'i mal rnam par brtsams /
translated: he prepares a bed of grass at the foot of a tree.

original: rang nyid kyis ltung ba'i rtsa ba shing gi 'dab ma dang 'bras bu rnams za zhing bsam gtan gyi bdud rtsis tshim pa'i yid grogs po dang 'dra bar ri dags dang / bya rnams kyis lta bar gyur bas rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ltung ba'i rtsa ba shing gi 'dab ma dang 'bras bu rnams za zhing bsam gtan gyi bdud rtsis tshim pa'i yid grogs po dang 'dra bar ri dags dang / bya rnams kyis lta bar gyur bas rnam par gnas te /
translated: He himself eats the roots, leaves, and fruits of the tree of downfall. His mind, satisfied with the nectar of meditation, is like a friend. He remains there, watched by deer and birds.

original: ri dags lhan cig rtsa dang 'dab ma @71b 'bras bu za //
analyzed: ri dags lhan cig rtsa dang 'dab ma @71b 'bras bu za //
translated: The deer eat the roots, leaves, and fruits together with him.

original: yul la chags pas yid kyi re ba log pa ni //
analyzed: yul la chags pas yid kyi re ba log pa ni //
translated: But his mind, which is attached to objects, is disappointed.

original: stobs 'bigs la yang kun nas 'pho ba skal can la //
analyzed: stobs 'bigs la yang kun nas 'pho ba skal can la //
translated: Even when he is pierced by a spear, he is not at all discouraged.

original: brten pa'i blo can rnal 'byor rnams ni 'dod par byed //
analyzed: brten pa'i blo can rnal 'byor rnams ni 'dod par byed //
translated: The wise yogis delight in him.

original: rtsva ni sngo ba gzhon nu'i grogs kyis bar ni bkag / me tog skyes pa'i shing dang 'brel pa bung ba can //
analyzed: rtsva ni sngo ba gzhon nu'i grogs kyis bar ni bkag / me tog skyes pa'i shing dang 'brel pa bung ba can //
translated: The grass is his young, green friend. He is surrounded by flowering trees and bees.

original: sred ba song ba lci ba'i sems ldan rnams kyi snying //
analyzed: sred ba song ba lci ba'i sems ldan rnams kyi snying //
translated: The hearts of those whose minds are heavy with the passing of craving

original: dka' thub can la nags kyis rnams rol par byed //
analyzed: dka' thub can la nags kyis rnams rol par byed //
translated: are gladdened by the forest for the one who practices asceticism.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni dka' thub chen po bsgoms pa'i thub rnams kyis //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni dka' thub chen po bsgoms pa'i thub rnams kyis //
translated: The future Buddhas, who have great ascetic practices,

original: re zhig dri med dka' thub 'bras bu rnams ni gnas par shog / gang zhig mda' yi tshogs 'bab pa yi 'jigs bas khyod la nam yang ni //
analyzed: re zhig dri med dka' thub 'bras bu rnams ni gnas par shog / gang zhig mda' yi tshogs 'bab pa yi 'jigs bas khyod la nam yang ni //
translated: You, who are never seen by the fearful faces of the arrows,

original: dam pa min pa'i gdong rnams mthong ba min pa de nyid bde //
analyzed: dam pa min pa'i gdong rnams mthong ba min pa de nyid bde //
translated: are happy indeed.

original: ri dags so yis gcod pa sngo ba rtsva gzhon myu gu'i rtsa ba can //
analyzed: ri dags so yis gcod pa sngo ba rtsva gzhon myu gu'i rtsa ba can //
translated: The deer, with their mouths full of tender grass and roots,

original: me tog 'byung ba'i shing gi tshogs la 'khor zhing smyo ba'i bung ba ni //
analyzed: me tog 'byung ba'i shing gi tshogs la 'khor zhing smyo ba'i bung ba ni //
translated: and the bees, hovering around the flowering trees,🔽are intoxicated.🔽The mountain streams, with their clear water flowing down,🔽and the mountain slopes, with their trees and herbs,

original: rab tu 'bab pa'i chu yi shugs kyis bkrus pa'i gsal ba rtsa ba dang // bsgoms pa rnams la ri yi cha rnams bde ba nye bar bskyed pa ste //
analyzed: rab tu 'bab pa'i chu yi shugs kyis bkrus pa'i gsal ba rtsa ba dang // bsgoms pa rnams la ri yi cha rnams bde ba nye bar bskyed pa ste //
translated: produce happiness.🔽The birds, with their hearts full of joy,

original: 'di ni skar ma'i bdag po ltar ni dga' ba'i sems kyis bya rnams ni //
analyzed: 'di ni skar ma'i bdag po ltar ni dga' ba'i sems kyis bya rnams ni //
translated: are like the lord of the stars.

original: bdag gi chu ni da lta 'di rnams dang ni 'brel bas gtsang ba ni //
analyzed: bdag gi chu ni da lta 'di rnams dang ni 'brel bas gtsang ba ni //
translated: My water, now connected with these, is pure.🔽The bodies of the yogis, washed by the mountain streams,

original: ri yi chu bo 'di ltar khrus kyis dus su rnal 'byor rnams kyi lus//
analyzed: ri yi chu bo 'di ltar khrus kyis dus su rnal 'byor rnams kyi lus//
translated: are like the bodies of the gods.

original: gus dang bcas pas reg ste rlabs kyi lag pa rnams kyis phrad 'dod ltar //
analyzed: gus dang bcas pas reg ste rlabs kyi lag pa rnams kyis phrad 'dod ltar //
translated: and, with reverence, touched him with their hands, as if they were waves.

original: de nas bdag nyid chen po de'i byams pa'i stobs kyis dbang du song ba grogs po bzhi byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid chen po de'i byams pa'i stobs kyis dbang du song ba grogs po bzhi byung bar gyur to //
translated: Then, by the power of the Great Being's love, four companions appeared.

original: nags de la ni yongs smin chang gi dbu ltar mig ldan pa //
analyzed: nags de la ni yongs smin chang gi dbu ltar mig ldan pa //
translated: In that forest, with eyes like ripe wine-berries,

original: zhi ba'i ri dags dang ni gtor mas rgyas dang lto 'phye dag / rnying pa'i aa ta si yi me tog rtse ltar 'od med yan lag can //
analyzed: zhi ba'i ri dags dang ni gtor mas rgyas dang lto 'phye dag / rnying pa'i aa ta si yi me tog rtse ltar 'od med yan lag can //
translated: peaceful deer, and peacocks with their tails spread, and serpents with their limbs as pale as old ashoka blossoms,

original: phug ron bsrabs pa'i khrag gi thigs pa ltar mig can //
analyzed: phug ron bsrabs pa'i khrag gi thigs pa ltar mig can //
translated: and with eyes like drops of dried pigeon's blood,

original: de rnams kyang bsam gtan gyi tha mar byang chub sems dpa' dang nye bar 'ongs nas slob ma rnams dul ba dang 'dra bar kun nas 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: de rnams kyang bsam gtan gyi tha mar byang chub sems dpa' dang nye bar 'ongs nas slob ma rnams dul ba dang 'dra bar kun nas 'dug par gyur to //
translated: they approached the Bodhisattva at the end of his meditation, and sat down all around him, like well-disciplined pupils.

original: de nas ri dags nye bar 'ongs te dul ba dang bcas par gsong por smra ba sngon du 'gro bas byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas ri dags nye bar 'ongs te dul ba dang bcas par gsong por smra ba sngon du 'gro bas byang chub sems dpa' la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the deer, having approached, sat down all around the Bodhisattva, with reverence, and with friendly greetings, they spoke to him:

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: 'jig pa las gzhan bdag chen la //
analyzed: 'jig pa las gzhan bdag chen la //
translated: apart from destruction,

original: shin tu che ba'i sdug bsngal med //
analyzed: shin tu che ba'i sdug bsngal med //
translated: there is no greater suffering.

original: skye ba dgar 'gyur 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: skye ba dgar 'gyur 'byung ba ste //
translated: Birth is a source of joy,

original: lus can @72a * //
analyzed: lus can @72a * //
translated: but for embodied beings

original: rnams la de med do //
analyzed: rnams la de med do //
translated: it is not so.

original: khva tas kyang 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: khva tas kyang 'di la smras pa /
translated: The crow also said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi phyed la dkris pa'i sdug bsngal las gzhan cung zad kyang lhag par lus thams cad kun nas gdung bar byed pa'i sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin te 'phags pas gzigs shig dang / khrel shes pa la yang ni bkres pas kun 'dzin pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi phyed la dkris pa'i sdug bsngal las gzhan cung zad kyang lhag par lus thams cad kun nas gdung bar byed pa'i sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin te 'phags pas gzigs shig dang / khrel shes pa la yang ni bkres pas kun 'dzin pa //
translated: Blessed One, apart from the suffering of being bound by half of my body, there is no other suffering that remains to completely burn my entire body. Look, Noble One, even those who are ashamed are completely overcome by hunger.

original: skyes bu'i yid ni bya ba min pa 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: skyes bu'i yid ni bya ba min pa 'byung ba ste //
translated: The mind of a person arises in inappropriate ways.

original: dge dang mi dge shes pa lkog gyur sems ldan pa'i //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge shes pa lkog gyur sems ldan pa'i //
translated: Those who know what is virtuous and nonvirtuous have hidden minds.

original: dud 'gro rnams kyi gang tshe yid ni phan par ltar //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams kyi gang tshe yid ni phan par ltar //
translated: When the minds of animals are seen to be beneficial,

original: de bas na ji ltar re zhig bkres pa'i sdug bsngal 'di yod par mi 'gyur ba de ltar gsungs shig / de nas ring nas 'ongs te thub pa'i mchog de shing gi rtsa ba na ni gnas //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar re zhig bkres pa'i sdug bsngal 'di yod par mi 'gyur ba de ltar gsungs shig / de nas ring nas 'ongs te thub pa'i mchog de shing gi rtsa ba na ni gnas //
translated: Then, after a long time, the supreme sage came, and he sat down at the foot of a tree.

original: dpung pa la gnas bsre'o pags pa 'dzin pa dbus ni dma' bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: dpung pa la gnas bsre'o pags pa 'dzin pa dbus ni dma' bar byed pa ni //
translated: The man who was carrying the meat on his shoulder, his skin wrinkled, his middle bent down,

original: khros pa las gzhan shin tu tsha ba'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal yod min zhes bya ba mar gyis snum pa'i dhri mi dhra yi bud med skra ltar gnag pa'i lto 'phyes smras //
analyzed: khros pa las gzhan shin tu tsha ba'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal yod min zhes bya ba mar gyis snum pa'i dhri mi dhra yi bud med skra ltar gnag pa'i lto 'phyes smras //
translated: said to the wife of Dhṛtarāṣṭra, her hair black as oil, “There is no suffering as hot as anger, no fruit as bitter as anger.”

original: rnam rtog bud shing 'bar ba can //
analyzed: rnam rtog bud shing 'bar ba can //
translated: The fuel of conceptual thought is ablaze.

original: khro ba'i sreg lugs za bas ni //
analyzed: khro ba'i sreg lugs za bas ni //
translated: The fire of anger burns

original: skye bo bdag nyid 'di bsreg ste //
analyzed: skye bo bdag nyid 'di bsreg ste //
translated: and consumes this very self.

original: gzhan dag bsreg par 'gyur ram min //
analyzed: gzhan dag bsreg par 'gyur ram min //
translated: Will it burn others or not?

original: bdag la thabs ni 'bras bu che //
analyzed: bdag la thabs ni 'bras bu che //
translated: I have a method that has great results.

original: de bas blo chen gsung bar mdzod //
analyzed: de bas blo chen gsung bar mdzod //
translated: Therefore, tell me, O wise one,

original: gang gis khro ba'i me 'di ni //
analyzed: gang gis khro ba'i me 'di ni //
translated: by what means can this fire of anger

original: rab tu zhi bar nye bar 'gro //
analyzed: rab tu zhi bar nye bar 'gro //
translated: be extinguished?

original: phug ron gyis smras pa /
analyzed: phug ron gyis smras pa /
translated: The pigeon said:

original: 'dod chags sdug bsngal thams cad ni //
analyzed: 'dod chags sdug bsngal thams cad ni //
translated: Desire is the cause of all suffering.

original: lhag par byas nas 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: lhag par byas nas 'jug pa ste //
translated: It is the one that makes you enter.

original: 'od ldan rnams kyi gzi brjid 'phro //
analyzed: 'od ldan rnams kyi gzi brjid 'phro //
translated: It is the light of those who are radiant,

original: nyin mo byed pas 'od zer bzhin //
analyzed: nyin mo byed pas 'od zer bzhin //
translated: Like the light of the sun.

original: zla ba'i 'od zer mdzes pa rnams//
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od zer mdzes pa rnams//
translated: The beautiful light of the moon

original: kha ba ltar bsil chu yang min //
analyzed: kha ba ltar bsil chu yang min //
translated: Is not cool like snow or water.

original: chags pa'i me yis kun khyab pa'i //
analyzed: chags pa'i me yis kun khyab pa'i //
translated: Desire is the fire that spreads

original: 'dod chags can la bde mi byed //
analyzed: 'dod chags can la bde mi byed //
translated: And does not bring happiness to the passionate.

original: de bas dam pa bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: de bas dam pa bdag la gsungs //
translated: Therefore, please tell me, O holy one,

original: cung zad legs par gsungs pa nyid //
analyzed: cung zad legs par gsungs pa nyid //
translated: What is the slightest bit good,🔽By which my mind, burned by the fire of passion,

original: gang gis chags pa'i mes bdag gi / sems ni slar yang tshig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis chags pa'i mes bdag gi / sems ni slar yang tshig mi 'gyur //
translated: Will not be burned again.

original: byang chub sems dpas gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gsungs pa /
translated: The bodhisattva said,

original: 'jig pa la sogs pa dang sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyi yang skye ba'i rgyu nyon cig / blo ldan rnams skye ba 'di la ma rig pa ni 'jug par byed par smra'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa la sogs pa dang sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyi yang skye ba'i rgyu nyon cig / blo ldan rnams skye ba 'di la ma rig pa ni 'jug par byed par smra'o //
translated: “Listen to the cause of the arising of these four kinds of suffering, beginning with destruction. The wise say that in this life, ignorance is the instigator.

original: mdor bsdus na ni ma rig pa yi rnam chad yod la 'du byed rnams ni rnam par 'gags @72b pa 'byung //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na ni ma rig pa yi rnam chad yod la 'du byed rnams ni rnam par 'gags @72b pa 'byung //
translated: In brief, the cessation of ignorance is the arising of the cessation of formations.

original: de las sred pa chad par 'gyur te len pa med par yang ni skye ba ni //
analyzed: de las sred pa chad par 'gyur te len pa med par yang ni skye ba ni //
translated: From that, craving ceases, and without appropriation, there is no birth.

original: nye bar len pa zhi bas srid pa rnams ni kun nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa zhi bas srid pa rnams ni kun nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Through the pacification of appropriation, existence does not arise.

original: srid pa chad pas sdug bsngal lci ba'i skye ba la sogs rnam par thim par 'gro //
analyzed: srid pa chad pas sdug bsngal lci ba'i skye ba la sogs rnam par thim par 'gro //
translated: Through the cessation of existence, birth and so on, which are heavy with suffering, dissolve.

original: de nas grogs po de rnams kyis slar byang chub sems dpa' la smras pa //
analyzed: de nas grogs po de rnams kyis slar byang chub sems dpa' la smras pa //
translated: Then those friends said to the Bodhisattva again:

original: sdug bsngal rtsa ba can gyi skye ba 'di la ji ltar yang chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rtsa ba can gyi skye ba 'di la ji ltar yang chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “How can this birth, which is the root of suffering, be stopped?”

original: byang chub sems dpas gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gsungs pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: gal te mchog tu gsal ba nye bar thob pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te mchog tu gsal ba nye bar thob pa'i phyir //
translated: “If you desire the supreme, clear attainment,

original: khyed cag 'dod pa yod na de yi phyir //
analyzed: khyed cag 'dod pa yod na de yi phyir //
translated: then for that reason,

original: zhi ba 'dod pa khyed rnams kyis //🔽srog chags 'tshe bar mi bya ste //
analyzed: zhi ba 'dod pa khyed rnams kyis // srog chags 'tshe bar mi bya ste //
translated: you who desire peace🔽should not harm living beings,

original: kun nas mi tshangs spyad mi bya //
analyzed: kun nas mi tshangs spyad mi bya //
translated: and should not engage in impure conduct.

original: brdzun du smra ba mi smra zhing //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba mi smra zhing //
translated: He does not speak lies,

original: dbang po'i tshogs ni gdul byas na //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs ni gdul byas na //
translated: Having subdued the host of senses,

original: de lta bu yi blo thob ste //
analyzed: de lta bu yi blo thob ste //
translated: He attains such a mind

original: gang gis skye ba'i shing 'di ni //
analyzed: gang gis skye ba'i shing 'di ni //
translated: By which this tree of birth

original: rnal 'byor shes pas rtsad nas 'don //
analyzed: rnal 'byor shes pas rtsad nas 'don //
translated: Is uprooted by the knower of yoga.

original: de nas grogs po de rnams kyis legs so legs so zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' la mngon par bstod nas rang rang gi gnas su song bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas grogs po de rnams kyis legs so legs so zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' la mngon par bstod nas rang rang gi gnas su song bar gyur to //
translated: Then those friends, exclaiming Excellent, excellent! greatly praised the Bodhisattva and went to their own abodes.

original: drang srong de'i gdams ngag dran nas kyang /
analyzed: drang srong de'i gdams ngag dran nas kyang /
translated: Remembering the sage's instructions,

analyzed: ri dags de thub pa 'dra bar skams pa'i rtsva dang / rang nyid kyis lhung ba'i shing rnams kyi 'dab ma rnams dang / rgya shug dang / mig gi 'bras bu rnams myang zhing ri bo'i nags de la gnas par gyur to //
translated: that deer lived in that mountain forest, eating dried grass like a sage, the leaves of trees that had fallen by themselves, jujubes, and berries.

translated: He tasted a little of everything, and then, content, he sat down.🔽The wind, which was shaking the flower-clusters without their sheaths,

analyzed: dri zhim nags kyi mtha' ma'i rlung ni 'thung byed cing //

original: bkres pa'i me ni bsren par dka' ba yod kyang ni //
analyzed: bkres pa'i me ni bsren par dka' ba yod kyang ni //
translated: though it was difficult to extinguish the fire of his hunger,

original: nam yang sbrul gyis byi ba rnams ni za ma gyur //
analyzed: nam yang sbrul gyis byi ba rnams ni za ma gyur //

original: phun ron gyis kyang ltung ba'i yongs su smin pa skya ba ni //
analyzed: phun ron gyis kyang ltung ba'i yongs su smin pa skya ba ni //
translated: The pigeons, too, ate the ripe, pale grain that had fallen,

analyzed: ma rmongs 'khrungs pa'i sa bon sa la lci ba'i snying po za //
translated: and the seeds that had been sown in the unconfused soil ate the heavy essence of the earth.

original: rab tu zhim pa mid pas dri med yid ni rnal 'byor ltar //
analyzed: rab tu zhim pa mid pas dri med yid ni rnal 'byor ltar //
translated: Having swallowed the very sweet food, their minds were as pure as those of the yogis.

original: nags de la ni lhan cig spyod pa lta bral spyod par gyur //
analyzed: nags de la ni lhan cig spyod pa lta bral spyod par gyur //
translated: In that forest, the companions, separated from their enjoyments, became ascetics.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnam par bye dpa'i mi dge ba'i las kun nas zad pa la bzhi po de yang srid pa gzhan la mi lus nyid thob nas slob bzhin pa zhi ba'i go 'phang nye bar thob par 'gyur te /🔽yon tan ldan @73a * //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnam par bye dpa'i mi dge ba'i las kun nas zad pa la bzhi po de yang srid pa gzhan la mi lus nyid thob nas slob bzhin pa zhi ba'i go 'phang nye bar thob par 'gyur te / yon tan ldan @73a * //
translated: The nonvirtuous karma that causes rebirth in the animal realm is exhausted. After attaining a human birth in another life, they will attain the state of peace while training.

original: pa rnams dang 'brel pa yis //
analyzed: pa rnams dang 'brel pa yis //
translated: Because of their connection with those who have good qualities,

original: des 'gro rnams kyang bzang po nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: des 'gro rnams kyang bzang po nyid du 'gyur //
translated: even the beings in the world will become good.

original: tha mar yang ni srid pa 'gag pa ni //
analyzed: tha mar yang ni srid pa 'gag pa ni //
translated: In the end, existence will cease.

original: dri med bsam ldan skyes bu smos ci dgos //
analyzed: dri med bsam ldan skyes bu smos ci dgos //
translated: What need is there to mention a person who has a stainless mind?

original: de ltar na tshul khrims dang mi ldan par gyur pa'i khyim gyi bde ba la mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas dka' thub kyi nags la mngon par dga' ba la bdag nyid dang ldan pa rnams kun nas zhugs par byed pa de'i phyir
analyzed: de ltar na tshul khrims dang mi ldan par gyur pa'i khyim gyi bde ba la mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas dka' thub kyi nags la mngon par dga' ba la bdag nyid dang ldan pa rnams kun nas zhugs par byed pa de'i phyir
translated: Thus, having reflected on the statement “Those who are not endowed with moral discipline and who are attached to the pleasures of the home life,” those who are endowed with a sense of self will enter the forest of asceticism.

original: // zhi ba 'dod pa'i shes rab kyis sreg lugs 'dzin pas kun nas khyab pa dang 'dra ba'i khyim dor nas zhi ba'i dgon pa la lhag par gnas par bya'o ;
analyzed: // zhi ba 'dod pa'i shes rab kyis sreg lugs 'dzin pas kun nas khyab pa dang 'dra ba'i khyim dor nas zhi ba'i dgon pa la lhag par gnas par bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, having abandoned the household life, which is like a burning house, one should live in the forest, which is a place of peace.

original: / dam pa'i skye bo dang 'brel bas legs par thob pa ni rnyed par sla ba ste //
analyzed: / dam pa'i skye bo dang 'brel bas legs par thob pa ni rnyed par sla ba ste //
translated: The good that comes from association with the holy is easily obtained.

original: de bas na dus rtag pa nyid du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na dus rtag pa nyid du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, one should always live in the company of spiritual teachers.

original: drang srong lda'i skyes pa'i rabs te skyes pa'i rabs lnga pa'o /
analyzed: drang srong lda'i skyes pa'i rabs te skyes pa'i rabs lnga pa'o /

original: // / tshul khrims la ni bsam pa kun zhugs pa //
analyzed: // / tshul khrims la ni bsam pa kun zhugs pa //
translated: He who is completely intent on morality,

original: skye ba chad phyir nges pa'i bdag nyid can //🔽lha yi bud med rnams dang rol pa yis //
analyzed: skye ba chad phyir nges pa'i bdag nyid can // lha yi bud med rnams dang rol pa yis //

original: brtan par nams ni 'gugs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtan par nams ni 'gugs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: even while sporting with them.

original: 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
translated: This is the story that is told.

original: yul b'a r'a na s'ir rgyal po'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i rgyal po tshangs pas byin la ka shi mdzes pa zhes bya ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: yul b'a r'a na s'ir rgyal po'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i rgyal po tshangs pas byin la ka shi mdzes pa zhes bya ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' byung bar gyur to //
translated: In the land of Vārāṇasī, there was a king named Brahmadatta, who possessed all the qualities of a king. He had a son named Kṣemaṅkara, who was a bodhisattva.

original: bdag nyid chen po de yang skye ba gzhan la nye bar bsags pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin du dam pa'i chos kyi nges pa bltas par gyur pa lang tsho dang po la yang bud med skye bos yid 'phrog pa'i mdzes pa'i gzugs kyi yul rnams
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po de yang skye ba gzhan la nye bar bsags pa'i shes rab kyis ji lta ba bzhin du dam pa'i chos kyi nges pa bltas par gyur pa lang tsho dang po la yang bud med skye bos yid 'phrog pa'i mdzes pa'i gzugs kyi yul rnams
translated: This great being, by the wisdom accumulated in other lives, saw the truth of the true Dharma just as it is. Even in his first youth, he did not go to the objects of the form realm that captivate the minds of men with their beauty,

original: dang smra ba nyid 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang smra ba nyid 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: rlung ni dpral 'phyang sgra yis brgyan byas dpral ba can //
analyzed: rlung ni dpral 'phyang sgra yis brgyan byas dpral ba can //
translated: Her forehead was adorned with the sound of a wind-blown brow-ornament.

original: mig gi rnam par rol pas yid 'ong 'dud byed pa //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par rol pas yid 'ong 'dud byed pa //
translated: With the play of her eyes, she bowed with a pleasing form.

original: mdzes pa'i lus can rnyas pas kyang ni dga' byed de //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i lus can rnyas pas kyang ni dga' byed de //
translated: She, with a beautiful body, was also delighted by the touch.

original: thub pa de ni chags pas rgyal ba ltar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: thub pa de ni chags pas rgyal ba ltar mi 'gyur //
translated: That sage was not like a conqueror, overcome by passion.

original: mchu ni spro ba rnam par rol pa rtse gcig de //
analyzed: mchu ni spro ba rnam par rol pa rtse gcig de //
translated: Her lips were playful, her single focus

original: tshig ni ci yang ngo tsha dang smra ba yi phyir //
analyzed: tshig ni ci yang ngo tsha dang smra ba yi phyir //
translated: with words, due to shame and speech.

original: padma'i 'dab ma sen mo'i rnam par 'bugs byed pa //
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma sen mo'i rnam par 'bugs byed pa //
translated: She pierced with her fingernails, which were like lotus petals.

original: rlung gis kun gdungs ljon shing ltar ni rnam 'dud gyur //
analyzed: rlung gis kun gdungs ljon shing ltar ni rnam 'dud gyur //
translated: The wind agitated him, and he bowed down like a tree.

original: des kyang byang chub sems dpa' dang nye bar 'ongs nas gsong por smra ba sngon du 'gro bas smras pa /
analyzed: des kyang byang chub sems dpa' dang nye bar 'ongs nas gsong por smra ba sngon du 'gro bas smras pa /
translated: He approached the Bodhisattva and, with a friendly greeting, said:

original: drang srong chen po yan par 'dod pas bdag cung zad cig smra bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: drang srong chen po yan par 'dod pas bdag cung zad cig smra bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: “Great Sage, I wish to speak a little, out of curiosity.

original: gal te ngo srung byed na mnyan par gyis shig ces zer ro //
analyzed: gal te ngo srung byed na mnyan par gyis shig ces zer ro //
translated: If you are willing to listen, please do.”

original: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: 'o na dbugs phyung ste smra bar gyis shig /
analyzed: 'o na dbugs phyung ste smra bar gyis shig /
translated: “Then speak with confidence.”

original: mi'am ci mos smras pa /
analyzed: mi'am ci mos smras pa /
translated: The kinnara said:

original: khyed kyi 'di yan lag med pa'i gzugs las lhag pa'i @74b mdzes pa gang du ste /
analyzed: khyed kyi 'di yan lag med pa'i gzugs las lhag pa'i @74b mdzes pa gang du ste /
translated: “Where is there anything more beautiful than this formless body of yours?

original: 'di yang rab tu thug pa med pa'i mig sman gyi phye ma ltar shin tu nag pa smar byung bas sngo bsangs yid 'phrog ma brtsams pa'i 'gram pa can dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ngo tsha bar byas pa dang / kun nas smin pa'i n+ya gro dha'i 'bras bu'i rnam par smin pa'i mchu dang ldan pa dang ;
analyzed: 'di yang rab tu thug pa med pa'i mig sman gyi phye ma ltar shin tu nag pa smar byung bas sngo bsangs yid 'phrog ma brtsams pa'i 'gram pa can dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ngo tsha bar byas pa dang / kun nas smin pa'i n+ya gro dha'i 'bras bu'i rnam par smin pa'i mchu dang ldan pa dang ;
translated: Her eyes are very dark, like the finest collyrium, and her cheeks are like the beginning of the lovely dark-blue color of the young tamala tree. Her lips are like the fully ripe fruit of the banyan tree, and they make the moon’s disk feel ashamed.🔽Her eyes on her lotus face are like utpala flowers, and her row of teeth is like a garland of jasmine flowers, white lotuses, the moon, and snow.

original: autpa la dang rjes su mthun pa'i gdong gi mig dang / kun da sar pa dang / zla ba dang / kha ba dang 'dra ba'i so'i phreng ba'i ze 'brus brtsams pa'i bzhin gyi padma'i 'di yang lang tsho sar pa'i bzo bos nyi ma re rer mdzes pa nye bar bsags par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: autpa la dang rjes su mthun pa'i gdong gi mig dang / kun da sar pa dang / zla ba dang / kha ba dang 'dra ba'i so'i phreng ba'i ze 'brus brtsams pa'i bzhin gyi padma'i 'di yang lang tsho sar pa'i bzo bos nyi ma re rer mdzes pa nye bar bsags par gyur pa dang /
translated: This lotus face of hers is created by the artist of youth, who accumulates beauty day by day.

original: me tog gi ro'i ze 'bru ltar dkar ba dang / mya ngan med pa'i 'dab ma ltar 'jam pa'i rkang lag dang ldan pa dang / shin tu yangs pa'i brang mngon par 'dod bzhin pa'i mdzes pas 'khyud pa dang 'dra ba dang / skye bo ma lus pa'i yid dang mig 'phrog pa dang /
analyzed: me tog gi ro'i ze 'bru ltar dkar ba dang / mya ngan med pa'i 'dab ma ltar 'jam pa'i rkang lag dang ldan pa dang / shin tu yangs pa'i brang mngon par 'dod bzhin pa'i mdzes pas 'khyud pa dang 'dra ba dang / skye bo ma lus pa'i yid dang mig 'phrog pa dang /
translated: He was the object of the eyes and the hearts of all men.

original: 'dod pa'i lta'i rten lus 'di gang du ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lta'i rten lus 'di gang du ste /
translated: He was the support of the body, which is the basis of the desires.🔽He was the object of the worship of all the people who were ripe for conversion.

original: yongs su smin pa'i skye bo rnams kyis bsten par bya ba dang / 'ga' zhig tu nye bar dmigs bzhin par rang bzhin gyis rtsub pa'i rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu'i kha zas can dang / sra ba'i ku sha'i rtse mo rnams kyis bgrod par dka' ba'i sa'i cha dang ldan pa'i mig mnyam pa'i ri'i 'gram dang /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i skye bo rnams kyis bsten par bya ba dang / 'ga' zhig tu nye bar dmigs bzhin par rang bzhin gyis rtsub pa'i rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu'i kha zas can dang / sra ba'i ku sha'i rtse mo rnams kyis bgrod par dka' ba'i sa'i cha dang ldan pa'i mig mnyam pa'i ri'i 'gram dang /
translated: He was in a place which was difficult to reach, because it was full of wild roots and fruits and the sharp points of kusha grass.

original: sbrul dang ri dags kyi skad mang pos 'jigs su rung ba'i nags kyi mthar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sbrul dang ri dags kyi skad mang pos 'jigs su rung ba'i nags kyi mthar gnas pa ste /
translated: He was in a place which was frightening, because it was full of the cries of snakes and wild animals.

original: 'di ni lha yi bu mo yang ni khyod kyi lus //
analyzed: 'di ni lha yi bu mo yang ni khyod kyi lus //
translated: This is the daughter of a god, and your body is like hers.

original: gal te yan lag med pa'i gzugs 'phrog mthong na ni //
analyzed: gal te yan lag med pa'i gzugs 'phrog mthong na ni //
translated: If you see a form that is without limbs,

original: lha rnams las ni ltad mo rnam par bzlog gyur pa //
analyzed: lha rnams las ni ltad mo rnam par bzlog gyur pa //
translated: then you will turn away from the spectacle of the gods.

original: 'dod pa mtho ba khyod la bsams pa nges par 'dzin //🔽gal te dka' thub bu mo'i skye bos khyod la ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa mtho ba khyod la bsams pa nges par 'dzin // gal te dka' thub bu mo'i skye bos khyod la ni //
translated: You who are high in your desires, you will surely hold to your thoughts.🔽If you see this one, who is a daughter of the ascetics,

original: lang tsho sar pas mngon par dga' ba 'di ltar mthong //
analyzed: lang tsho sar pas mngon par dga' ba 'di ltar mthong //
translated: with her youthfulness, you will be filled with joy.

original: me tog mtshon cha mnga' yis sems la 'bigs pa ni //
analyzed: me tog mtshon cha mnga' yis sems la 'bigs pa ni //
translated: The flower-weaponed one will pierce your heart,

original: dka' thub la ni gus pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur snyam //
analyzed: dka' thub la ni gus pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur snyam //
translated: and you will not hold to your devotion to asceticism.

original: 'dod lha gzhu ni bdungs par byas pa de la min //
analyzed: 'dod lha gzhu ni bdungs par byas pa de la min //
translated: The bow of the god of love is not drawn against you,

original: bud med kyi ni yan lag rab tu rid par byed ;
analyzed: bud med kyi ni yan lag rab tu rid par byed ;
translated: but it is the limbs of a woman that are emaciated.

original: / gang gis shin tu yangs pa'i mig can khyod kyi gdong //
analyzed: / gang gis shin tu yangs pa'i mig can khyod kyi gdong //
translated: Your face, with its very wide eyes,

original: 'di ni zla ba ltar ni yid 'phrog mthong ba ltar //
analyzed: 'di ni zla ba ltar ni yid 'phrog mthong ba ltar //
translated: is as captivating as the moon.

original: zla ba sprin las bral ba ltar ni khyod kyi bzhin //
analyzed: zla ba sprin las bral ba ltar ni khyod kyi bzhin //
translated: Your face is like the moon free from clouds,

original: gsal pa'i mdzes pa dang ldan 'di la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gsal pa'i mdzes pa dang ldan 'di la gnas pa ste /
translated: and it is here, with its clear beauty.

original: ri dags mig can rnams dang nges par ni //
analyzed: ri dags mig can rnams dang nges par ni //
translated: And the deer-eyed women,

original: ri dags mo rnams la yang @75a * //
analyzed: ri dags mo rnams la yang @75a * //
translated: And the does,

original: g-yo ba med par 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yo ba med par 'gyur //
translated: Will be unmoved.

original: bud med bzhin ni rim gyis gyen du blta byas nas //
analyzed: bud med bzhin ni rim gyis gyen du blta byas nas //
translated: Looking gradually upward at the face of a woman,

original: gang gis yun ring phyir ni thig le byas gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gis yun ring phyir ni thig le byas gyur pa //
translated: With which you have long made love,

original: lag pa de 'od shin tu 'jam pa ci yi phyir //
analyzed: lag pa de 'od shin tu 'jam pa ci yi phyir //
translated: Why, O hand, do you not tremble

original: shing rnams len pa'i phyir ni khyod kyis nges par sbyar //
analyzed: shing rnams len pa'i phyir ni khyod kyis nges par sbyar //
translated: In order to take hold of the tree?🔽Fresh, white as the filaments of a lotus,

original: gsal ba gsar pa ge sar ltar ni dkar ba dang // nor bu sna tshogs rgyan dang mchog gi gos 'os pa //
analyzed: gsal ba gsar pa ge sar ltar ni dkar ba dang // nor bu sna tshogs rgyan dang mchog gi gos 'os pa //
translated: Worthy of ornaments of various jewels and of the finest garments,🔽How will your body, with its hard garment of skin,

original: khyod kyi lus kyi sra ba'i gos dang pags pa dang // shing gi lo ma rnams ni ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod kyi lus kyi sra ba'i gos dang pags pa dang // shing gi lo ma rnams ni ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: Hold the leaves of the tree?

original: mdza' mo'i gdong rnams la ni khyod kyis lta ba 'di //
analyzed: mdza' mo'i gdong rnams la ni khyod kyis lta ba 'di //
translated: This your looking at the faces of your sweethearts

original: 'dam skyes mngon par gsar pa rnams la bung ba ltar /
analyzed: 'dam skyes mngon par gsar pa rnams la bung ba ltar /
translated: Is like that of a bee at newly blossomed lotuses.

original: sbrul ngang ri dags rab tu mang ba'i nags rnams la //
analyzed: sbrul ngang ri dags rab tu mang ba'i nags rnams la //
translated: In the forests, so full of snakes and deer,

original: mdzes pa'i gdong can 'khor bar byed pa mdzes pa min //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i gdong can 'khor bar byed pa mdzes pa min //
translated: It is not proper for one with a beautiful face to be a wanderer in cyclic existence.

original: dbang phyug la ni 'dod pa bral ba'i yid can khyod kyis ni //
analyzed: dbang phyug la ni 'dod pa bral ba'i yid can khyod kyis ni //
translated: You, whose mind is free from desire for the lord of wealth,

original: gang zhig dka' thub brtul zhugs nges par 'brel ba'i yid re bas //
analyzed: gang zhig dka' thub brtul zhugs nges par 'brel ba'i yid re bas //
translated: who has a mind definitely connected with the practice of asceticism,

original: ma lus pa yi longs spyod 'dzin pa'i skye bos khyab pa yang //
analyzed: ma lus pa yi longs spyod 'dzin pa'i skye bos khyab pa yang //
translated: even though the world is filled with people who possess all enjoyments,

original: mar me shi ba bzhin du khyim deng snang bar gyur pa min //
analyzed: mar me shi ba bzhin du khyim deng snang bar gyur pa min //
translated: the house today appears to me as if a lamp has gone out.

original: de bas na shin tu mang po smras pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na shin tu mang po smras pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Therefore, what is the use of speaking so much?

original: bdag gi grogs mo mi'am ci'i bu mo yid de gang gi drung du gzugs la mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i lha'i bud med kyi skye bo yang ngo tsha bar byed de //
analyzed: bdag gi grogs mo mi'am ci'i bu mo yid de gang gi drung du gzugs la mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i lha'i bud med kyi skye bo yang ngo tsha bar byed de //
translated: In the presence of my friend, the kinnara maiden Manoharā, even the celestial women, who are proud of their beauty, feel ashamed.

original: de yang ri bo nags kyi nang du kun nas 'khor ba'i khyod mthong nas rnam par 'gyur ba su zhig yang 'ongs nas /
analyzed: de yang ri bo nags kyi nang du kun nas 'khor ba'i khyod mthong nas rnam par 'gyur ba su zhig yang 'ongs nas /
translated: She, having seen you completely surrounded by the forest mountain, changed her appearance and came back.

original: nyi ma re rer kun nas skya ba dang / lus kyi srog shing rab tu rid pa dang / dbugs tsha bas mchu mngon par brel pa dang me tog gi mal stan dga' ba rnams la yang gnyid mi phebs pa dang / mtshan mo bud med kyi gdong la khyad par du byed pa'i skar ma'i bdag po la yang sdang bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: nyi ma re rer kun nas skya ba dang / lus kyi srog shing rab tu rid pa dang / dbugs tsha bas mchu mngon par brel pa dang me tog gi mal stan dga' ba rnams la yang gnyid mi phebs pa dang / mtshan mo bud med kyi gdong la khyad par du byed pa'i skar ma'i bdag po la yang sdang bar byed pa dang /
translated: She hates the moon, the lord of the stars, which is especially on the face of a woman at night.

original: dpyid ka'i zla ba la kha byed ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i snyem dang yang dag par 'brel bas rlung tsha ba'i skyed mos tshal rnams la yang rol par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dpyid ka'i zla ba la kha byed ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i snyem dang yang dag par 'brel bas rlung tsha ba'i skyed mos tshal rnams la yang rol par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: She is not at all interested in the gardens of the hot winds, which are connected with the pride that is the cooperating cause of the spring month’s opening of the flowers.

original: yang ba dang / bsil ba dang / ri bong can gyi cha ltar dkar ba'i padma'i rtsa ba'i gdu bu rnams 'dzin par byed cing /
analyzed: yang ba dang / bsil ba dang / ri bong can gyi cha ltar dkar ba'i padma'i rtsa ba'i gdu bu rnams 'dzin par byed cing /
translated: She holds lotus roots that are light, cool, and white like the moon’s digit.

original: rnam pa gang gis kyang grogs mo'i skyo ba sangs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis kyang grogs mo'i skyo ba sangs pa ste /
translated: In no way does she relieve the sadness of her friends.

original: ngo tsha ba dang bcas pa'i 'og tu lta ba'i mig can des kyang ze 'bru'i me tog dang rjes su mthun pa'i rkang pa'i mthe bong gis sa'i dkyil du mngon par bri bar byed pa'i dben sa @75b na gnas pa de la grogs mo bdag la 'di lta
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang bcas pa'i 'og tu lta ba'i mig can des kyang ze 'bru'i me tog dang rjes su mthun pa'i rkang pa'i mthe bong gis sa'i dkyil du mngon par bri bar byed pa'i dben sa @75b na gnas pa de la grogs mo bdag la 'di lta
translated: The one with eyes cast down in modesty, with the big toe of her lotus-like foot, which was in harmony with the lotus flower, drew a circle on the ground and said to that one who was staying in a secluded place, My friend, I am in this situation.

original: bu'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba 'dod pa'i gtam smras pa /
analyzed: bu'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba 'dod pa'i gtam smras pa /
translated: She spoke these words of desire.

original: kun nas snying pa'i me tog tsam pa ka'i phreng ba ltar kun nas skya ba dang rid pa'i yan lag bstan par byas nas khyod kyi drung du bdag brdzangs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas snying pa'i me tog tsam pa ka'i phreng ba ltar kun nas skya ba dang rid pa'i yan lag bstan par byas nas khyod kyi drung du bdag brdzangs pa ste /
translated: Having shown her limbs, which were completely pale and emaciated like a garland of jasmine flowers, she said, I was sent to you.

original: de bas brtse ba nyid ni dmigs byas nas //
analyzed: de bas brtse ba nyid ni dmigs byas nas //
translated: Therefore, having taken pity,

original: bud med yang dag 'brel las bzlog pa yang //
analyzed: bud med yang dag 'brel las bzlog pa yang //
translated: turn away from the connection with a woman.

original: 'dod pa'i me yis sems ni tshig pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i me yis sems ni tshig pa ni //
translated: The mind, burned by the fire of desire,

original: bdag gi grogs mo'i sems la dga' bar gyis //🔽gnas la lhag par gnas pa'i dka' thub nor can gyis //
analyzed: bdag gi grogs mo'i sems la dga' bar gyis // gnas la lhag par gnas pa'i dka' thub nor can gyis //
translated: rejoices in the mind of my friend.🔽 The one who was rich with the wealth of austerities, who was staying in a secluded place, said to her, My friend, listen to my words:

original: dka' thub kyi ni 'bras bu 'di ni bsam par byed //
analyzed: dka' thub kyi ni 'bras bu 'di ni bsam par byed //
translated: This is the fruit of austerities, which is thought of by those who are rich with the wealth of austerities.

original: yun ring por ni ma lus cha la mkhas pa yi //
analyzed: yun ring por ni ma lus cha la mkhas pa yi //
translated: “The pleasure of enjoying women for a long time,

original: bud med rnams dang ltan cig longs spyod bde gang yin //
analyzed: bud med rnams dang ltan cig longs spyod bde gang yin //
translated: without any loss, and with skill in the arts,🔽is not the same as the pleasure of enjoying a single night.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de'i bdag nyid kyi dgongs pa de rnam par shes nas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de'i bdag nyid kyi dgongs pa de rnam par shes nas smras pa /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, understanding her intention, said:

original: sring mo re zhig smos shig /
analyzed: sring mo re zhig smos shig /
translated: “Sister, speak first.”

original: mi'am ci'i bu mo de na tshon gyis khyod lhag pa yin nam /
analyzed: mi'am ci'i bu mo de na tshon gyis khyod lhag pa yin nam /
translated: “Is that kinnara maiden older than you,

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: or not?”

original: des smras pa ;
analyzed: des smras pa ;
translated: She said:

original: de bdag gi na tshod lhag ces zer ro //
analyzed: de bdag gi na tshod lhag ces zer ro //
translated: “She is older than me.”

original: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva said:

original: gal te de ltar yin na de bas khyod nyid la bdag gis da lta nyid du mthong ba'i lus gzhan dang 'dra bar mthong zhes zer te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na de bas khyod nyid la bdag gis da lta nyid du mthong ba'i lus gzhan dang 'dra bar mthong zhes zer te /
translated: “If that is so, then I see your body now as if it were someone else’s.”

original: gang gis khyod kyi tshig ni 'jam pa lngar byung ba /
analyzed: gang gis khyod kyi tshig ni 'jam pa lngar byung ba /
translated: “Your words were soft and gentle before,

original: des ni de ring shin tu rtsub pa'i dbyangs ldan pa //
analyzed: des ni de ring shin tu rtsub pa'i dbyangs ldan pa //
translated: but today they are very harsh.

original: dang po 'di ni ji ltar bzhin ni 'byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: dang po 'di ni ji ltar bzhin ni 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: First, your face was like this,

original: shin tu yid 'ong de ltar khyod la da ltar min //
analyzed: shin tu yid 'ong de ltar khyod la da ltar min //
translated: but now it is not so attractive.”
